name: We do Music Day Party
description:
We do Music presents Day Party at Salling Rooftop

THE MUKHERJEE DEVELOPMENT – your musical pick-me-up (12.00 – 12.20) 
"The Mukherjee Development, with American/Danish/Indian frontman Oscar Mukherjee, is reputed to be among Denmark's best live bands – a claim that holds true, with British Coldplay almost being outshone," recently wrote music magazine GAFFA after attending a concert, awarding it 5 stars.

MIRIAM MANDIPIRA & THE SOUL FAMILY – power, presence, and a massive voice (12.40 - 13.00)
Soul, pop, and Afro styles blend beautifully with a vocal performance that's truly world-class. Listen to songs from the band's debut album 'NDIWE'.

MATHILDE FALCH & THE BAND – intense, passionate, and engaging (13.20 - 13.40)
Mathilde Falch, who participated in Toppen Af Poppen in 2021, is known for her uncompromising, strong, wild, yet vulnerable, psychological songwriting. Listen to songs from her brand new album 'Hvert Sekund'.

BABY DID A BAD THING – melancholic Americana (14.00 - 14.20)
Powerful songs and personal stories about universal themes from the latest critically acclaimed album by the Aarhus-based band. Acoustic and vulnerable yet electric and confident.

IDA NIELSEN – "you can't fake the funk!" (14.40 - 15.00)
Get down to funky beats with the Danish world-class bassist, who played with Prince for 6 years until the legend's passing in 2016. Now touring the world under her own name, she's been recognized as one of the top 10 bassists in the world.

name: Ria Qvist
description: When Ria Qvist sings about her childhood memories and the experience of feeling like a clown in a circus, it's from a different perspective than most others. Behind the artist name is the singer and songwriter Maria-Louise Lundqvist, whose vision consists only of shadows and light. Often, other people's considerations turn into a pity that makes her feel misunderstood, which the listener understands when struck by the beautiful, detail-oriented, and uncompromising songwriting. Drawing inspiration from Sebastian and Guldimund, Ria Qvist is a present and honest storyteller who tells stories that intrigue in a completely different way.

name: South of Limbo
description:
The band name describes a feeling - the feeling of a break from everyday life, as well as a need to challenge the blue melancholy with warmth and straightforwardness. It's the feeling the boys in the band get when they write and play music together, and which they strive to convey to the audience.

The English-language synthpop is delivered by the four friends from Middelfart, who found their creative voice together in Middelfart's youth house. The band supported Barselona on their autumn tour and continues as support for KALASET's sold-out Store Vega show in April.

Additionally, they will perform at Jelling Music Festival in connection with the final of Quasar, a career and talent development program for upcoming artists in rhythmic music in the Region of Southern Denmark.

name: Athelas Sinfonietta
description:
Featuring Li-Ying Wu, Matias Vestergård Hansen, Bára Gísladóttir, and Mette Nielsen. 

ATHELAS Sinfonietta Copenhagen presents contemporary composed music from the 21st and 20th century. ATHELAS consists of 16 musicians, each of whom is characterized by their desire and ability to work with innovative projects that break aesthetic barriers. 

Li-Ying Wu (b. 1978) is originally from Taiwan, but has lived in Denmark since 2003, where she studied composition at the Royal Danish Conservatory of Music and electronic composition at DIEM in Aarhus. Wu has written music for a large number of Danish and international ensembles, orchestras and choirs. Her music explores sound and its evolution through composition, engaging in a dialectic of ideas that offers a reciprocal perspective on both Asian and Western culture.

Trained in piano and composition, Matias Vestergård Hansen (b. 1989) is a versatile composer who moves fluidly between large dramatic musical works and chamber music. In the autumn of 2017, he premiered the ballet ‘THE FORGOTTEN CHILDREN’ at the Royal Theatre, and since then he has premiered several operas at, among others, Copenhagen Opera Festival and the opera in Helsinki. In 2023 he won a Reumert for his opera ‘LISBON FLOOR’ and in the same year he received the Young Artistic Elite from the Danish Arts Foundation.

Icelandic Bára Gísladóttir (b. 1989) is a composer and double bassist based in Copenhagen. Her work is generally based on thoughts about the approach and the concept of sound as a living being. Gísladóttir has worked with a large number of Danish and international ensembles, and has received several awards for her work, most recently The Ernst von Siemens Music Prize 2024. She is also an active musician and regularly plays her own music solo or with her long-time collaborator Skúli Sverrisson, as well as double bass player in Elja Ensemble.

Composer Mette Nielsen (b.1985), trained in composition from the Royal Danish Academy of Music and the Royal Academy of Music, works with ensembles of all sizes, soloists, choirs and orchestras. In April 2023, she had her first orchestral piece performed by the Odense Symphony Orchestra, and the same spring the album ‘Frozen Moments’ was released with the NOVO Quartet and Jonas Frølund with her string quartets and works for the basset clarinet.

The concert is part of SPOT FLUX, a collaboration between the Danish Composers' Society and SPOT Festival, which presents new orchestral music in a new setting. SPOT FLUX is presented in collaboration with Art Music Denmark and is supported by the Augustinus Foundation.

name: Cano
description:
There hasn't been a moment in David Cano's life where he hasn't worked with either film or music. About a year and a half ago, he started the project Cano, where community and friendship are two of the most important building blocks. The music is created in collaboration with his best friends, and he hopes that can be heard. The goal is for it to feel like when you see your best friend cry for the first time.

Cano has been selected for KarriereKanonen with the song 'jeg ik alene mer', which he describes as epic bedroom pop.

name: P.t.
description:
The Danish music scene now offers a fresh breeze in the form of the Odense duo P.t.

Behind the name stand two prominent figures: lead singer and songwriter Erik Apollo, with a background in TÅRN, and bassist, studio musician, and producer Larle Damsgård. Together, they create uplifting indie-pop that invites the listener into a charming sing-along universe where there is room for both deep emotions and light, danceable pop songs.

name: Sylfide
description: Sylfide unfolds the contrasts between folk tradition and experimental songwriting, allowing space for both mystique, wildness, and fragility. Alone on stage, armed only with the harp and a stack of pedals, the past is both mirrored and distorted through electro-acoustic effects, grainy reel sounds, and minimalist beats.

name: Fenja
description:
If one were to point out two things that are absolutely essential for Fenja, it would be the Danish language and nature. It's when she looks up at the starry sky, jumps in puddles, or rides through the forests that she feels most present - and at the same time, most small. And this can be felt in her music. The first song she ever wrote was about climate change and a polar bear losing its home because of it.

In addition to nature, music has always been a refuge for Fenja, who goes by Freja outside of the world of music. The hope is that her music can act in the same way for those who listen to her songs. And give that primal feeling she herself seeks.

Fenja has been selected for KarriereKanonen with the track 'Brænder for noget'.

name: PLAIINS
description:
PLAIINS hit you like a freight train - fast-paced songs that infect you with their fist-pumping, feet stomping power! Founded by London-raised singer Chris in Hamburg, the quartet are growing from the soil made fruitful by the likes of IDLES, QOTSA and TURNSTILE.

Since the release of their debut single ‘The Wolf’ in March 2022, Dizzy, Flo, Timon and Chris have already racked up over 800k streams and caught the attention of industry players and fans alike. Alongside radio airplay on stations in Germany and internationally, they were featured extensively in the “BBC Introducing” program as well as on BBC Radio 1.

With their just released EP ‘BLOW UP THE FIZZ’ they are showing themselves as a multi- facetted, modern rock outift with a diverse backlog of songs, that is always uniquely “them”.

Whether opening for acts like Itchy, Press Club and LEAP or in their own highly energetic headline shows, they have proven themselves as a raw power, highly passionate live act.
Currently writing their anticipated debut album, PLAIINS are about to become a mainstay in the international rock scene.

name: EMIL
description:
Five years ago, EMIL started writing his own songs. It's his channel, his words, and the place where he expresses his thoughts. And sometimes it happens in a somewhat intense way. As it happens, EMIL likes to shout.

On polished productions, EMIL's powerful vocals provide the contrast that frames what he himself calls indulgence pop. It’s gutter poetry with punk energy, frayed edges and a pop production, that makes everything a bit neat again. Like if Rasmus Seebach and King Krule had a lovechild.

EMIL has been selected for KarriereKanonen with the song 'Jeg har taget fri'.

802 made their live debut at the prestigious The New Colossus Festival in New York in the summer of 2023, and back home they have already been praised by media outlets such as Devilution, Metal A Day, and in prime time on P6 BEAT. Their captivating concerts and distinctive sound have also led Politiken to call 802 "one of the best contenders for an act that can chart a new course for the metal genre."

This year, 802 has been announced for Bloom, Copenhell, and Roskilde Festival. And even more is on the way.

name: alga
description:
alga is an alternative pop-duo in their early 20’s and consists of Alberte Silberbrandt and Gabriel Blachmann. With hard hitting productions and heartfelt vocals, alga delivers an original sound, a kind of new age trip inspired by both hyperpop and trip hop. With Blachmanns forceful electronic productions and Silberbrandts crispy vocals and storytelling lyrics, alga combines both genres, traditions and atmospheres. 

alga is critically acclaimed by both Soundvenue and GAFFA and has stormed onto the Danish upcoming stage with recent releases ‘Don’t Call’ and ‘Feeling of U’. According to the programme DEBUT on P6 Beat, alga is one of the bands that has brought the DnB genre to young audiences in Denmark.

name: Lea Kampmann
description:
Lea Kampmann is an up-and-coming Faroese singer-songwriter, known for her ability to capture the listener's heart with her sensitive vocals and profound lyrics.

With her debut in her native language and collaboration with the renowned musician Teitur Lassen, Lea has created a unique musical universe that speaks to both the heart and soul. Her performances are known for creating an intimate atmosphere, where the audience is invited into a space of calm and reflection. Lea is not just a singer; she is a storyteller, whose songs have the potential to reach beyond the shores of the Faroe Islands, touching listeners all over the world.

Lea Kampmann made her debut in October 2017, with the EP ‘Common Blue’, and was nominated for four Faroese Music Awards in 2018, winning the prize for ‘Artist of the Year’. In 2022, she released the album ‘If I Ever Made You Cry, I'm Sorry’, which received a 4-star review in GAFFA, and she also supported Katinka Band on tour in the autumn of 2022.

name: Åh Buster
description: Åh Buster is a new project from Aalborg, which creates raw everyday scenarios. The ambition is to describe love, shame, loneliness, hope, and other aspects of life in an authentic and bare manner. The language is poetic yet direct, and when you listen to Åh Buster's songs you understand who the artist behind it is - you might even feel that he understands you a little bit. Inspired by the children's film "Buster's World," Martin was nicknamed Buster as a child, and it has stuck with him through thick and thin ever since. Martin has previously released music in English but is now fully focused on his Danish-language, everyday poetic project, Åh Buster. In addition to his concert at SPOT, he will be performing his Danish songs at RUST and Skråen in the spring.

name: ilinx
description: ilinx was born out of a desire to explore the human voice’s potential to create and foster human connections. The three singers' backgrounds range from classical music to folk and R&B. After their well-received debut album ‘Memory’ in 2020 they have played critically acclaimed concerts in Denmark and Europe, ranging from avantgarde festivals and vocal rituals (ALICE CPH, Radar, Bijloke, CHART ART fair, UNM, Alter festival), to supporting big pop names (FRAADS in Vega).

name: hun_sagde
description:
Emma, the artist behind hun_sagde, has created a universe where Nordic melancholy takes center stage, combined with 90s-inspired trip-hop beats and grungy guitars. It's the soundtrack to your contemplative walk by the water, where sea and sky merge into one big gray mass.

A bit like how it looks for most of the year in western Jutland, where hun_sagde hails from. hun_sagde is a character Emma can pour all emotions into. As a private individual, Emma isn't always sad, but actually "pretty happy." But with hun_sagde, Emma cultivates sadness and the experience of being introverted yet expressive. To rest in melancholy and emerge from it again.

hun_sagde has been selected for KarriereKanonen with the song 'Grå skyer'.

name: Hollow Ship
description: Hollow Ship's groovy music mixes sounds of early British psych with mind expanding funky afro-rock. Sweet analogue sonic qualities are fused with modern technique creating their own distinctive sound. Their debut album, ‘Future Remains’, is a powerful statement of intent from a band who refuse to operate within self imposed parameters. In 2024 Hollow Ship returns with a new album.

name: iiris
description:
iiris is an Aarhus-based art-pop duo consisting of Anders Skadhede and Thilde Dam. Together, they write songs that everyone needs when the emotions of everyday life become too overwhelming to face alone. These are stories about the fear of growing up, long-distance relationships, and playing too hard-to-get to message your crush. In January 2023, the duo released their debut EP, ‘Kradser Ik’ Længere Mine Hænder’, taking the listener on a journey from a broken heart to finally becoming their own main character again. iiris is not afraid to share aspects of their private lives, making the lyrics personal and sincere, yet humorous and unpretentious. For iiris, melodies are a crucial element in their songs, and as a listener, it's hard not to sing along to the playful choruses and hooks.

iiris has performed at events such as SEEK, RAMA festival, and most recently, SPOT, in a packed Rå Hal at Godsbanen, earning much praise from an audience that laughed and cried throughout the show. On stage, iiris is known for both the simple duo setup and the grand nine-person band, including strings, backup singers, and a VJ. Their concerts are intimate, intense, humorous, and filled with gimmicks and sing-along moments that are hard to forget.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: NEBULAH
description:
NEBULAH is a feminine & progressive rock front trio of vocals and guitar with musical inspiration drawn from artist such as Radiohead and PJ Harvey. The sonic landscape is completed by heavy bass and the partially electrified drums.

The genre is a hybrid between rock, singer/songwriter and worldbeat. Through sound-manipulation, choral harmonies and the use of electronic elements the band is presenting a new and distinctive sound. 

Storytelling is a key element in NEBULAH’s music portraying a dark hope that nature once again will reign but also the dilemmas and crisis that follow. NEBULAH leaves the audience with an invitation to drift away in inner pictures of ever-changing nature scenery alongside the musical landscapes.

The songs are dealing with toxic relationships, generational breakdown, longing, fear and the desire for freedom - portrayed in relatable stories about the human interaction with nature and our human nature.

name: Elias Njovu
description:
Elias' musical journey has been long and with several bumps along the way. It started with an identity tied to choir singing in his younger years, a break with that identity and his own self-image when his voice broke, and rediscovering the love for music through music production and songwriting at the Rhythmic Music Conservatory.

The culmination of that journey is about daring to dive into waters that may be a bit too deep and is beautifully wrapped in elements from R&B, hip-hop, and more electronic genres.

Elias Njovu has been selected for KarriereKanonen with the song 'Jeg vil ikke sige for meget'.

name: Aarhus Kammerorkester
description:
Featuring Stine Benjaminsen, Louise Alenius and Magnus Plejdrup

Aarhus Kammerorkester (Aarhus Chamber Orchestra) is a professional, medium-sized ensemble based in Aarhus, made up almost entirely of the city's leading musicians aged 18-40. The orchestra's vision is to create sympathetic communities through classical music, and to be the city's ambassadors to spread classical music to new audiences. 

Stine Benjaminsen (b. 1990) is a Danish composer and performer. Her compositions are often built around poetry, where text is included either directly as lyrics, or indirectly as inspiration to create the music. She investigates timbre in intuitive and sensuous compositions where the music insists on a slowness and openness, and illuminates the simple and fragile. Stine is inspired by human relationships, nature, and connections/contrasts. She has written music for choirs, classical ensembles, electronics, chamber music and vocal music and has collaborated with visual artists and art museums.

Composer, librettist, music producer and performer Louise Alenius (b. 1978) works interdisciplinarily with score music as a starting point and has created over 100 musical works, including two operas, three ballets, orchestral works, film music, 15 performance works, hybrid works based on e.g. augmented reality and 3D sound, several choral works, and a large number of songs, three album releases, and installation works/sound art. Alenius is concerned with ethical and society-related themes and has created award-winning dramatic musical works about e.g. euthanasia, modern rituals, power relations, incest, and life in a prison. She has received a number of awards, including Carl Nielsen and Anne Marie Carl Nielsen's Honorary Award.

Magnus Plejdrup (b. 1995) is a Danish composer and conductor based in Aarhus. He is the artistic director of the Aarhus Chamber Orchestra and part of the artistic management behind the Aarhus Chamber Music Festival. He has studied composition at the Royal Academy of Music (2018-21) and conducting at the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland. Plejdrup has had works performed by a number of Danish ensembles and has received several awards, including Carl Nielsen and Anne Marie-Carl Nielsen’s Talent Prize 2023 and Leonie Sonning's Talent Prize 2022.

The concert is part of SPOT FLUX, a collaboration between the Danish Composers' Society and SPOT Festival, which presents new orchestral music in a new setting. SPOT FLUX is presented in collaboration with Art Music Denmark and is supported by the Augustinus Foundation.

name: Mona Moroni
description:
Mona Moroni is nostalgia pop that embraces a wide audience, appealing to both young and old. It's music that exudes closeness and a universe where one feels safe and at home. The group was formed from a shared love of Danish pop music from the 1980s, drawing connections to nostalgic children's films like ‘Busters Verden’, ‘Gummi Tarzan’, and ‘Zappa’.

Mona Moroni’s aim is to give the audience a musical embrace while also challenging the listener with the experimental roles in the arrangements. To let the music facilitate a break in the sometimes busy and hectic everyday life.

The young group is still quite early in their career but has already gained traction, with a selection for Vegas Udvalgte 2023 and a concert at SPOT 2023.

name: Selma Judith
description:
With her brave, vulnerable lyrics and a distinctly unique musicality, Selma Judith navigates through the soft realms of R&B, melodic pop, and jazzy undertones in an ambitious musical project. Since Selma Judith released her first songs under her own name, she has experimented, surprised, and embraced her own way of being an artist.

And now, there's something new on the horizon from the woman behind the critically acclaimed debut album 'Getting Angry, Baby.' In 2023, Selma Judith released two remarkable and honest singles, 'Eat Your Soul' and 'Mediocre.' An upcoming album from the singer is just around the corner, and she has announced her first Denmark tour in autumn.

name: Maline
description:
Based on a challenging upbringing and a life filled with bitter experiences of love, Maline writes about her relationship with the complicated and euphoric emotion of love. With her strong and sincere voice, Maline exposes the pain in the hope that others can relate to the desire to be loved and the fear of being abandoned. The Aarhus-based indie-pop project took its first steps in 2020, and in the fall of 2023, the debut album 'Elsk Mig' was released, followed by three headline concerts around the country.

With spine-chilling and tear-inducing honest songs, Maline guides you through a microcosm of life's intense emotions. With her distinctive and crisp voice, Maline articulates what we all feel but find difficult to talk about - the need to be loved and the shame of being the clinging person expressing that need. Maline's longing indie-pop consists of simple yet well-chosen ingredients: Heartbreaking Danish lyrics, beautiful timeless melodies, organic beats, and an embracing, atmospheric synth universe. The music spans from heartfelt ballads to epic compositions with swirling melodies and eclectic beats.

name: Verge
description:
Verge was raised on underground rap from Atlanta. Rapping in English was cool. And Danish was the opposite.
Although it was previously difficult for Thor, the man behind Verge, to make the lyrics sound right in Danish, it has become easier over the years. Because this is where he best expresses the emotions that can sometimes be difficult to put into words.

Music has become his platform. A place where he metaphorically can cry into the paper while writing.
The music is inspired by the hip-hop he grew up with. Both old school and new school. The lyrics are honest and the beat is gritty.

Verge has been selected for KarriereKanonen with the song 'Hverdag'.

name: Blikfang
description: On stage, Søren Gade, aka Blikfang, is an explosion of both movement and sound, characterized by lively dance and a voice that can easily energize an entire festival site. Beyond being a rock star on stage, Søren Gade is also an essential voice for his generation. In August 2023, Blikfang released the critically acclaimed EP 'Vær Dig Selv'. As the title suggests, the EP addresses topics such as one's relationship with own identity, gender, body, and expression – the courage to be oneself in front of loved ones and the world. 'Vær Dig Selv' draws on references from everything, from tv-2 to the music in a Japanese arcade hall. On the EP, Søren Gade's distinctive vocals deliver lyrics that sound like they're taken from an intimate, personal conversation deep into a summer night. Blikfang always shines brightly in the sun.

name: Jessie Ka
description: One should not be fooled by Jessie Ka's feminine, soft vocals. Her music has an understated and sarcastic bite, and growing up in "the dark North Jutland" has left its melancholic mark on her English-language pop universe. She's not afraid to showcase her weakest and ugliest sides for others to mirror themselves in. Her reflective lyrical universes present us with life as a woman and speak to topics such as: Nice girl conditioning, body shame, stress, and society's view on what "a real woman" is. Drawing inspiration from dark pop and hyperpop, Jessie Ka paints strong pictures in our minds. She does so in an extremely relatable universe about identity, about being a woman, and about the pursuit of being allowed to be oneself, and trying to learn to give zero fucks and follow one's own heart.

name: Miller
description:
Miller is a Danish-language Alt-Rock band that pushes genre boundaries by blending modern electronic elements into a 90s punk-rock universe.

The four members deliver lyrics with a relatable expression that captures the listener's attention.

Their energetic performances and laid-back approach to social media have resulted in them amassing over 160,000 streams in their first year.

name: PALLAS
description:
PALLAS creates hyper-pop music that feels like that summer day when all your friends are out drinking wine at sidewalk cafes, but you'd rather revel in your emotions and stay home. Where you end up lying in the bathtub and actually have a self-care day, doing something good for yourself. PALLAS is daydreams in musical form.

It's also in high school daydreams that Nora, the woman behind PALLAS, first conceived the musical project. There, in ancient history class, she learned that the nickname for a young girl in Greek mythology is Pallas.

And so, the first stones were laid for the music that comes from a young girl's perspective and gives you the feeling of standing and crying a little on a dance floor.

PALLAS has been selected for KarriereKanonen with the song 'Puppy Luv'.

name: Boy With Apple
description: Boy With Apple transports you to another universe with their dreamlike pop. A mesmerizing world of eternal sunlight, long embraces from someone you love and unconditional comfort. The band's emotionally charged shoegaze manages to convey all that and more and their latest releases is a vibrant message of what the members are capable of and ends up somewhere in between Beach House and DIIV, with a distinctive electronic touch. On the horizon is their debut album set for March 15th, shows at New Colossus Festival in New York, SXSW in Austin and, of course, Spot Festival in Aarhus.

name: Cucuun
description:
Dressed in grandiose longing and imaginary wings, Cucuun invites you into her sparkling pop universe. Here, airy synths and hooky melodies blend together in a hyper-feminine and electronic expression. With her heartfelt vocals and dramatic presence on stage, she insists on capturing your senses' full attention.

Cucuun challenges the concert format with her experimental curiosity in performance. With a theatrical approach, movement, stage design, and costume are incorporated into the live presentation of the music.

Through her songs, Cucuun aims to address and represent the exaggerated self-centeredness and individualization that contribute to the widespread discontent prevalent in the young generation she herself belongs to.

name: Frequens
description:
Frequens is an Aarhus-based instrumental funk/fusion band, with several members having played together for more than a decade. Frequens guarantees good vibes and a complete musical experience. They make the point that music should be felt both in the body and in the mind, so it doesn't become too navel-gazingly introverted. The music flows freely from the four-member strong lineup, and they hope to convey the joy of playing. The music is both groovy, beautiful, heartfelt, and a pure energy release.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: Nikolaj Storebjerg
description:
Wearing his emotions on his sleeve and with lyrics that come straight from the heart, Nikolaj Storebjerg is truly his own. This can be heard when he steps into the spotlight, where the young man explores the big emotions and complex thoughts of the 20s.

He is a singer and songwriter, singing about what most people can relate to: the many facets of love, life's unpredictable twists and turns, as well as the political aspects of war, climate, and chaos.

Drawing inspiration from artists like Jeff Buckley, Nick Drake, and Tim Christensen, Nikolaj Storebjerg plays songs that will make most indie-folk/pop hearts beat faster.

name: Maria Faust Jazz Catastrophe: 3rd Mutation
description:
Saxophonist and composer Maria Faust is renowned and respected worldwide for her award-winning ensembles Sacrum Facere, Machina, and Jazz Catastrophe. Although her unique musical language as a composer and singular improvising style are easily identified, she is difficult to place in the kanon of contemporary jazz and composition. This is partly due to the broad spectrum of her influences and also because her music goes beyond stylistic definitions and into the realm of the deeply personal. Today Maria Faust is one of the most celebrated and established Estonian musicians of all time, recipient of numerous awards and prizes from Estonia and Denmark (where she resides), but also a celebrated artist all over Europe and slowly but surely catching the attention of American audiences.

Maria Faust´s Jazz Catastrophe was originally founded in Copenhagen in 2012 as a modern big band, and the current album documents its third mutation. Concentrated and reduced down to its essence like a thick syrup, the new music is performed by a trio where Maria Faust´s alto saxophone is flanked by long-time associates Lars Pilgaard on guitar and Anders Vestergaard on drums.

name: Dupont
description:
Community garden rock. That's how the group Dupont describes their music. And what does that mean? Besides the fact that an allotment in Skive forms the framework for Dupont as a group, it's music that, like an allotment garden, provides peace and space to be oneself. It's liberating music. Music that speaks to the body and forces you to lay your emotions on the table - in fact, to shout them out.

Dupont has been selected for KarriereKanonen with the song 'Night Terrors'.

name: Clapper
description:
Hailing from Aarhus, the danish quartet Clapper juxtaposes classic soul- and fusion jazz vibes with the wonk and groove of modern instrumental hiphop. Their debut album ‘On Tempo’ showcases the group’s knack for melodic improvisation and neck-snapping switchups.

The four members - Frederik Emil Bülow (drums), Adrian Christensen (bass), Jeppe Lavsen (Guitar), and Malthe Jepsen (Piano & Rhodes) - are well-known faces on the young Danish jazz scene, also playing with other acclaimed acts such as Abekejser, Hvalfugl, and Ipek Yolu.

Based on their long collaborative history, they’re able to strum out new music through fun, and improvising over riffs.

The same fun and playful energy translates to their live shows - regular tour de forces in beat-focused jazz that, although the melodic cheerfulness might deceive new listeners, often end up in high-octane fusion workouts with crowds and musicians alike on their feet.

name: Moyka
description:
Moyka is on the radar within a new generation of alternative pop. Since her EPs ‘Circles’ (2019) and ‘Spaces’ (2020), we have been able to follow Moyka on her journey as an artist, songwriter, and producer, without her ever compromising her true self. She has built up a catalog with a clear identity and garnered attention from international heavyweights like Billboard, Notion, and The Line of Best Fit.

Moyka's second album, ‘Movies, Cars & Heartbreak’, was released in October 2023. The concept album is a cinematic journey from start to finish, exploring themes of self-development through love and heartbreak. The album is a focused collection of catchy pop songs and artistic synth sequences that make you feel like life is a movie. It’s about those moments where you feel so alone in a world that seems so enormous, trying to navigate what seems like a never-ending highway of emotions. It’s about going fast and falling hard, taking chances, daring to believe in love and celebrating these big emotions that make us who we are.

name: Kalaha
description:
In addition to being an extremely captivating and high-energy live band, Kalaha is known for being endlessly exploratory in their search for musical frontiers and geographical spectrums. With elements ranging from acid rock and improvised jazz to Anatolian funk and acid techno, Kalaha has managed to create a completely unique universe since 2013. A place between roots, jazz, and electronic.

Kalaha is known for igniting the dance floor and entrancing the audience. As a listener, you are one moment in a breathtaking car chase through the bazaar in Istanbul, and the next moment, you are floating in the cosmic eternity of space, only to land in a dusty village in Mali.

Kalaha released their new sixth album, 'Nord Havn,' in January 2024, an album recorded over two weeks in outer Nordhavn, Copenhagen's old industrial harbor. Through nine original compositions, Kalaha pays tribute to their hometown - and to the memory of an area in the city where gentrification is truly accelerating.

name: Klostermand
description: Klostermand is a rapper from the soil of Northern Jutland who preaches that you should be yourself, whether it's awkward or not. The man behind the project, Jens Munk, is passionate about the beautiful nature and supreme silence that life in the countryside brings, and the lyrical universe radiates honesty and genuine Danish coziness. With a sound inspired by classic hip-hop mixed with salsa rhythms, jazz harmonies, and pop hooks, Klostermand paints a sincere picture of a young lad trying to find his way in life.

name: Berg
description:
At the age of 18, Berg had her artist name tattooed on her neck. There has never been a plan B for Alberte from Copenhagen, who creates pop music that sounds like it came from Narnia. You never quite know what's hiding in the wardrobe. The music moves in the directions of indie, rock, and electronic - always with a poppy undertone without filters.

Berg has been selected for KarriereKanonen with the song 'Hen i morgen', which is about daring to set boundaries for oneself.

name: Ævestaden
description: Ævestaden is a Swedish-Norwegian trio that merges traditional and modern folk music in a unique way with varied instrumentation and evocative lyrics. Their songs are folk-pop with a twist, unafraid to blend the clean and gritty, electronic and traditional. This is evident in how modern lyrics seamlessly integrate with the use of electronic instruments as well as traditional ones like cow horn, kravik lyre, and mouth harp. Their second album, ‘Solen var bättre där’ (The Sun Was Better There), released in September 2023 on Supertraditional, solidifies their place in the folk music scene.

name: Alpas Ave
description: Alpas Ave hits you like a thunderstorm in slow motion - ominous and wildly captivating all at once. Tremendous sub-bass and shrieking synthesizers form the basis of their alternative sonic universe, in which Mariannes ethereal and breathtaking vocal evolves. Back in 2021 the duo consisting of Marianne Ernst Dam and Martin Pilgaard Grishauge released their critically acclaimed debut EP ‘Black Mirror’. They are currently working on their upcoming debut album, 'The Woman in Ashes' (2024) - a fantasy-inspired piece about longing, anger, euphoric freedom and womanhood.

name: APHACA
description: APHACA creates music that, in their own words, "simply works, without knowing why or how." The result is a completely immediate and pure pop sound, featuring harmonious – sometimes dissonant – boys' choir, 70s synthesizers, acoustic guitar, and indie drums in a colorful sonic universe marked by the ecstasy and confusion of youth. The debut album 'ET AAR UDEN DIG' (2022) is the perfect blend of APHACA's consistent visual and sensory universe, which can be summarized as dandelion pop.

name: EF
description: From Gothenburg, Sweden, EF emerged in 2003, captivating audiences with emotionally charged instrumentals skillfully blended with northern melancholy, indie rock riffs, and bursts of hardcore. Debut album ‘Give Me Beauty... Or Give Me Death!’ (2006) quickly solidified their post-rock standing while their unique use of tender vocals set them apart in the genre and attracted a diverse fanbase. In late -22, EF released ‘We Salute You, You and You!’ on Pelagic Records, marking their 5th album and celebrating 20 years of creativity.

name: Godt Gået Frej
description:
Godt Gået Frej embraces the inner fool. He excuses himself and everyone else, stating that it's okay to be a bit silly from time to time. There's a little person inside him, someone who humblebrags, preaches about waste sorting but still throws plastic into general waste when having a bad day. The name Godt Gået Frej is a loving pat on the back to himself, an attempt to say that all the strange things happening inside his head are just as okay as all the good things. Frej writes pop songs because he enjoys it. He hopes people can recognize themselves in what he writes and perhaps say 'well done' to themselves a bit more often.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: Lasse Matthiessen
description:
Lasse Matthiessen is particularly known for his powerful, deep, and expressive voice. He lives in Berlin and Copenhagen and has established himself firmly in Germany with his vibrant and electronically grounded songs. Lasse is played on German radio stations, has been interviewed by the most widely read German newspapers, and has performed on the largest German TV shows.

After a recently successful tour in Germany, where his intense and emotionally charged songs were warmly received, Matthiessen is now ready to delight the audience at the SPOT Festival.

Lasse Matthiessen has supported artists such as Anna Calvi, Suzanne Vega, and Glen Hansard, and is also known for the soundtrack from the Netflix series ‘Supersex’ released in March 2024.

name: Rebebe
description: The Danish alt-pop talent, Rebebe, released her debut EP, 'What Are You Into,' in 2022. The release followed two previous singles and confirmed her unique talent, which had already garnered attention for the young artist, both in Denmark and on the international scene. Rebebe's voice is almost provocatively full of presence, insistent, and dynamically alive with unexpected intonations, constantly shifting between confident power and anxious vibrato. With lyrics drawn from reality, Rebebe puts words to her own life, everything that comes to mind, what she sees, encounters, and observes. It is music without filters, censorship, and other algorithm-friendly limitations. The singer's latest release is the EP 'Deserving,' which came out in 2023.

name: Melodi Ghazal
description:
Imagine Britney Spears spinning around in a Sufi meditation to a beat that combines 90s and 00s-inspired pop production with the Iranian music tradition. Melodi Ghazal challenges cultural and musical boundaries as she writes, sings, and produces her hybrid pop-R&B.

In Melodi's universe, inner and outer worlds collide with fragile strength and a warm, humorous character. She blends the best from multiple worlds, and in 2023, the Danish-born Iranian was categorized as one of the 'most promising music acts' of the year by Soundvenue.

After an impressive debut EP, several successful live concerts, and her own headliner tour in Denmark, Melodi Ghazal collaborates with Villads Klint (Minais B) on new songs that tell the musical story of her many homes.

name: Among Phantoms
description:
Metal should be felt all the way to your fingertips. And so it does when it comes from Among Phantoms. If you're into energetic and hard-hitting live shows, you can't ignore the Aarhus-based band, who with a groovy and versatile take on melodic hardcore are ready to blow the audience away and give them an explosive concert experience they won't soon forget.

Among Phantoms will release their latest single 'Scavengers' in April 2024.

name: Vingard
description:
This Danish artist (settled in Berlin) released her debut album ‘In The Long Run’ last year. It's been praised both domestically and internationally with words like “timeless”, “clear”, and “honest”. The magazine GAFFA hails it as a promising debut.

At the age of 9, Vingard picked up the guitar, and just six years later, she was composing music for a German film. Since then, she has performed over 300 concerts, including sold-out tours in Germany. On stage, her compelling vocals hit home, while her honesty fills the room, challenging societal norms.

Vingard is releasing new music on April 19, 2024.

name: Diane Emerita
description: Diane Emerita has the captivating ability to capture honesty with her deep and emotionally charged voice. Nevertheless, it is her complementary imaginative piano playing that forms the basis for her adventurous and raw sound. Diane Emerita's music stems from alternative pop structures, classical piano training, and soulful singing. The 21-year-old Diane grew up in Germany and Sweden but has already lived in several other  places around the world. Today, she resides in Malmö. She describes how the many relocations have left their mark, posing a certain difficulty in feeling a sense of belonging. However, in music, she has found her place, and there is no doubt that she is here to stay. In 2020, she released her first album, 'Black Blue Sky,' featuring tracks like 'Lullaby,' followed by the single 'To Simply Be' in 2022. In the spring of 2024, Diane is releasing her upcoming EP 'Travelling Forever,' which is made in collaboration with the former Grammy-nominated producer Hampus Norén. The first single 'The Irrational,' was released in January.

name: Håkon Berre – Mirror Matter
description: Håkon Berre has established himself as one of the most interesting drummers on the Danish scene for improvised music. His inventive drumming has brought him to numerous clubs and festivals all around the world, and can be heard on a discography spanning 44 albums. Håkon is active as a co-leader in numerous bands and has collaborated with artists such as Peter Brötzmann, Phil Minton, John Tchicai, Jamie Branch, Susana Santos Silva and Peter Evans.

name: Dos Santos
description:
Dos Santos is Christian Lima Dos Santos Ringsing. There is joy, but also a lived-through melancholy in his music. It is a tale of a little dancing boy on the kitchen floor in a Copenhagen childhood home, weaving his life together with the rhythms of his mother's homeland, Brazil. The 22-year-old talent embraces the philosophy of samba – the colors and the celebration – and brings it into a personal narrative of loss and longing. His debut EP 'SAMBA' (2023) is primarily the sound of freedom and the words of a young man with an open outlook on life – about daring to let go of what you have, to hold on to the important things in life; oneself, joy and dance.

The EP was recorded in close collaboration with the two producers, Nicolai Gabold (Julias Moon, Elisha, among others) and Niels Christian Sommer (Ganger, among others), creating a rhythmically grounded expression where R&B-inspired catchy melodies blend with electronic beats and cinematic soundscapes.

name: Infant Finches
description:
Infant Finches play backwards warped rock, balancing between straight forms and cryptic motives sealing itself in a frame of noise, feed and shimmering guitars.

The two band members, Jan Philipp and Frederik Bruun, formed Infant Finches in Köln merging their inspirations from the city’s Kraut-rock legacy with the fluid vibrations from the US art-rock scene. Their sound is driven by aesthetics from bands such as This Heat, Deerhoof, Women and Stereolab bringing together mathy, polyrhythmic loops and wobbly sounds into a song-like form

In June 2022 the band released their debut album ‘Sci-Fi Immune’ which was thoroughly featured by radio stations such as WDR1 and Deutschlandfunk and nominated for ‘Best Newcomer’ by PopNRW. Following the release, the band toured around Europe visiting France, Belgium, Holland, Germany and Denmark.

name: LIN
description:
LIN navigates musically between classic singer/songwriter compositions, jazzy harmonies, and a neo-soul sound. She writes songs with the voice of youth. Directly and unapologetically.

In her music, she insists on an honest and raw encounter with the listener through lyrics that are sober and immediate, addressing themes like identity, liberation, and relationships repeatedly.

name: maenske
description:
maenske is Danish eighties-inspired groove-pop, describing deeply processed emotions through poetry with thick strokes of philosophical contemplation. An evening in the company of maenske is an evening in the company of an artist who seeks to bear witness to the audience with stories and experiences, marked on their own body and soul. Musically, maenske will remind you that life both loves and hates you at the same time. This realization will become evident through the stage performance when maenske takes the stage.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: Naked
description:
Feat. Nicklas Sahl, Angående Mig, Troels Abrahamsen, and Brimheim

You won't want to miss this year's NAKED when SPOT opens the doors to the intimate concert space, where renowned singers redefine their material in front of the audience's eyes.

In this vulnerable format, the singers take turns going solo on stage, accompanied only by the Swedish multi-instrumentalist Gustaf Ljunggren on piano. Unique concert experiences are guaranteed as familiar songs take on new expressions.

This year, NAKED presents four exceptionally talented singers. Since his debut in 2018 and breakthrough hit ‘New Eyes,’ Nicklas Sahl has managed to captivate Danish ears and hearts with a melodic richness and a voice like few others. 

Angående Mig has established herself as one of Danish pop's most intense and outspoken voices with groundbreaking songs like 'jeg elsker alt hvad du hader ved mig' and 'BLOMSTER I LAKKEN'.

One of the most prominent newcomers on the alternative pop and rock scene - both in Denmark and internationally - is Brimheim. Ever explorative and impossible to pigeonhole, she delves into the most intimate corners and unreconciled depths of the mind. 

Since 2004, Troels Abrahamsen has stood as the frontman of the legendary rock band VETO. And it will be a carefully selected potpourri of songs we can look forward to experience in a vulnerable and naked format.

name: Ninna Lundberg
description:
Following the great success with the band Ganger, Ninna Lundberg released her debut solo album ‘Two Two of You’ in 2022. A collection of personal narratives carried by her sensitive and raw vocals, set against a backdrop of dusty piano melodies and dynamic brass and string arrangements.

In live performances, Ninna collaborates with saxophonist Viktor Kongsbak, double bassist Thorbjørn Kaas, and musician/singer Mille Djernæs. They perform songs from Ninna's debut album alongside new material that effortlessly transitions between the grand and atmospheric and the deeply personal and intimate.

name: Swartzheim
description:
Swartzheim delivers a massive and skillfully crafted wall of sound when the six young men take the stage with no less than three guitarists. They play snarling, aggressive crossover metal and ensure that the tempo is high throughout.

2023 was a busy year for the young band, who, in addition to many live concerts, won the Danish edition of Wacken Metal Battle and released the EP ‘Sympathy’.

If you're into hard guitar riffs, 110 km/h, and chaotic live energy, you don’t want to miss out on Swartzheim.

name: Tex
description: Copenhagen based Swedish alt-R&B/soul artist, producer and multi-instrumentalist Tex has been featured in BBC1, KCRW, Clash, Matt Wilkinson’s Show & The Line of Best Fit. The single  ‘Wander, Wondering’ was produced by Paul White (Danny Brown, Sudan Archives) and in his early years living in London he initiated collabs with Cajm, at the time part of the boundary pushing Young collective TTY. Tex’ 'Sound of You' was furthermore played on Frank Ocean's Homer Radio show on Apple Music in 2023, alongside touring in the UK, Scandinavia and Portugal. Tex also supported buzzing newcomer Waterbaby at Vega in late autumn 2022.

name: Sitrekin
description:
Sitrekin's ethereal voice is known worldwide. Behind the alias is Kirstine Stubbe Teglbjærg, former lead singer and songwriter of Blue Foundation. With the multimillion-streamed Twilight soundtrack song 'Eyes on Fire,' she has achieved cult status from Siberia to New York. Now, she returns with her own atmospheric electronic indie sound, infused with touches of melancholic pop, strong melodies, and beautiful sonic details.

Sitrekin released in 2021 the single 'Open Chest,' which topped the charts on P6 Beat and gained international attention, including on KEXP. In the fall of 2023, Sitrekin was featured in an interview in Rolling Stone Magazine, and her voice went viral on TikTok through #hoahoahoahoa #hoahoaseason.

Heavyweights like CLASH Magazine and EARMILK have recently taken notice of Sitrekin's sound, with glowing reviews of her latest single 'As I Moved On' - a reinterpretation of the Blue Foundation hit from the breakthrough album 'Sweep of Days.' Sitrekin released this to celebrate the album's 20th anniversary in February 2024.

name: Forsling&Hauch
description:
Forsling&Hauch is a new and exceptional collaboration on the electronic scene in Denmark. Their music is an intense journey where analog synthesizers and acoustic drums blend into a captivating sonic universe. Their expression ranges from atmospheric and cinematic soundscapes to danceable beats and deep bass.

The Copenhagen-based duo, consisting of Mika Forsling and Frederik Hauch, will release their debut album "Idiolekt" in April, and their concert at SPOT festival marks the album's release. Additionally, Forsling&Hauch will be joined on stage by the young Swedish trumpeter and composer Ellen Petterson, who, besides her own music, also performs live with Sara Parkman and Alice Boman.

Forsling&Hauch have performed concerts in both Denmark and Sweden, including at DR Koncerthuset in Copenhagen and PLX in Malmö.

name: KEDDE
description:
The pop talent from Southern Jutland, KEDDE, is soaring. He gives words and sound to the fragile existence of humans. Growing up in the countryside in Sønderborg, he draws inspiration for his music from his upbringing. The lyrical universe is based on personal experiences, revolving around deeply felt, down-to-earth subjects that cut straight to the heart. The sound offers catchy choruses with space for both dancing and reflection. The production is built on a smoldering and pulsating soft-house '4-on-the-floor' vibe. All carried by KEDDE's unique voice, blending the lyrical and instrumental elements.

His latest single, 'Sådan Må Det Være,' describes a relationship that doesn't work – a relationship one didn't choose: the family relationship. It's about the sad acceptance that things don't change because that's how it has always been. In the verses, KEDDE zooms in on his own life, portraying the specific scenario where he stands right outside the door about to enter a place where he doesn't feel at home. In the chorus, he zooms out, precisely describing the feeling and singing to everyone: 'It is what it is, and that's how it must be. We don't want to be here – but that's how it must be.'

name: døtre
description:
døtre creates vocal-based, voluminous, electronic art-pop that explores various aspects of femininity. The lyrical space is honest and theatrical, allowing room for both embrace and pettiness. Through collaborations with other artists who interpret the music through elements such as costumes, stage designs, or choreography, each concert takes on a cross-aesthetic and unique expression. In 2024, døtre will insist that femininity is not only fragile, graceful, and introverted but also raw, fierce, and ugly.

døtre released their debut single ‘follow’ in April 2023 and the EP ‘I'd Rather Stay Awake’ in February 2024. døtre consist of Nynne Spangegaard Rasmussen, Sofie Herdorf Krøyer, and Sophus Dræby, who together compose, arrange, and produce the music. Mathias Carl Gyvlgaard on bass, and Tobias Nygaard on drums. Choir and choreography: Jean Anastasia, Laura Teglhøj, Didde Strand, Mathilde Thrane, and Maiken Funder.

name: Jonah Wright
description: Jonah Wright is a dynamic entertainer and a true music enthusiast with a deep passion for his craft. He blurs the boundaries between genres in his world of commercial pop/rock tunes, complemented by catchy hooks and rap flows. Strong melodies, combined with the streetwise rap flow, infused with a touch of jazz finesse, and delivered with the raw energy of a punk band, aptly describe the live experience one gets in the company of Jonah Wright. He is an artist with heart and madness - born to push boundaries. Behind this musical wildness lies a storyteller with an approachability that can make even the lost and condemned feel at home and secure.

name: JOSVA
description: Aarhus-based JOSVA is one of the most interesting names on the Danish music scene in the intersection of urban and R&B. In 2021, JOSVA released his debut work 'Alting/For Evigt' under the Aarhus-based label PAIDMEN Music, followed by the album 'Er Du Ude?' in 2022. With over 8 million streams on Spotify and collaborations with, among others, Artigeardit, Topgunn, Pind, Omar, and Karl William, JOSVA has already made his mark in the industry. Most recently, JOSVA was featured on the single 'Aldrig Doven' by Marcus.wav.

name: Gennem Tågen
description:
After hiding in a basement in Aarhus for over 15 years, the black metal duo Gennem Tågen debuted with their first album, ‘Koldt Betragtes Verden’, and their first live concert at the end of 2023.

The style is old-school black metal with inspiration from the Norwegian second wave and a strong focus on atmosphere and melody. There are no synthesizers here, but frequent use of acoustic guitar instead. The lyrics are in Danish and focus on the tumultuous relationship between humans and nature.

For the concert at SPOT, songs from the debut album as well as its follow-up, ‘Sindets Mørke’, will be performed, both produced by Quentin Nicollet and set to be released later in 2024.

name: Astrid Helena
description:
Astrid Helena Frej Møller seeks to touch our collective vulnerability through sounds and words. The singer and electronic composer with roots in classical music weaves her voice with elegance into a diverse range of electronic soundscapes - some flowing and ethereal, others featuring pulsating, sometimes aggressive beats - bridging the gap between the familiar and the unknown.

Astrid Helena's use of improvisation as a tool means that each performance is unique and shaped by and within the moment, resulting in spontaneous musical interactions.

name: Ella Augusta
description:
Despite her young age, Ella Augusta has already made a mark with some remarkable collaborations. In late 2022, she released the song 'Når Solen Skinner,' which served as the outro melody for Jonas Risvig's popular TV series 'Grænser.' The song caught the attention of Lord Siva, who invited her to feature on the duet 'Jeg Vil Have Dig Helt' for his new album '8 Dage I April.' More recently, the singer joined Benjamin Hav on P3's Uundgåelige with the song 'Første Dag.' The latter also led Ella Augusta to guest appearances on Hav's extensive autumn tour, where they performed in front of over 10,000 people at Royal Arena.

On stage, audiences can experience the young songwriter's music from her upcoming album, accompanied by talented musicians who bring out her presence and intimate voice. Her latest single, 'Internetsangen,' released in January, has already garnered over 250,000 streams. With its sharp and direct lyrics, the song explores a constantly available youth, where the mobile phone is always within reach.

name: genskaer
description: With the sound of late summer nights, juice coursing through their veins, teenage melancholy, and longing, Genskaer creates a sonic universe in true indie-pop/rap style, with lyrics marked by honesty, youthful dreaming, and presence.

name: Kindsight
description:
With their second album ‘No Shame No Fame’, the danish indie rock 4-piece Kindsight follow up on a year with performances at Roskilde Festival and SXSW in Texas among others.

The debut album ‘Swedish Punk’ from 2022 received glaring reviews from the Danish music press. And the first single from the upcoming album has drawn parallels to the canadian band Alvvays. In continuation of the release of ‘No Shame No Fame’, the band tours Scandinavia during the spring and summer of 2024.

name: Emmeluth’s Amoeba
description: Emmeluth's Amoeba consists of 4 curious musicians from Oslo and Copenhagen. The group has toured extensively for the past 3 years, including live concerts at Saalfelden Jazz Festival, Artacts and Oslo Jazz to name a few. With creative music that moves through characters of free jazz to chamber music like shapes with fierce energy, it is hard to be left untouched. In the intersection between composed material and free improvisation new music is made, sounding different every time. The group released their latest record ‘Nonsense’ in February on Swedish Moserobie Music Productions, and it has received good reviews and feedback.

name: KLØVER
description:
The boy band from northern Zealand aims to exemplify the uniqueness of a clover with their uplifting melodies, dreamy productions, and honest rap. The three old friends open the door to a universe that touches on love, nostalgia, and the confusion of youth.

In a sound that tastes a bit like a summer party, beer-soaked lips, and world conquest, KLØVER sets the stage for a party you actually want to be a part of.

KLØVER won Popkorn Nordic '23 - the Danish/Swedish career and talent development program for acts from Zealand and Skåne.

Perhaps KLØVER is even the best thing to come out of Helsingør since Hamlet? Come and judge for yourself.

name: Snuggle
description:
Baby in Vain singer and songwriter Andrea Thuesen and former Liss producer Vilhelm Strange join worlds to create snuggle. Both guitar players by heart, snuggle’s sounds are abundant with riffs and ethereal fx. Their sonic symbiosis weave guitars and breathy vocal harmonies into a fuzzy blanket evoking wall-of-sound music melting with eclectic drum productions.

While they both have been writing and playing music from before they could speak, the new constellation snuggle has only existed for a little over a year. In the fall of 2023 they released their debut EP ‘Calendula’. On their most recent release ‘Dorthea’ they elaborate on the dueling guitars and ghostly vocals giddying up the horses towards shoe-gaze horizons in 2025.

name: Victor Aage
description: With the release of his debut single in January, Victor Aage earned the title "Denmark's New Crooner." With the Hollywood coolness of the 1950s and a vocal range as vast as his emotional strength, Victor embodies fearless grandeur in his music. Despite his young age, he has performed countless concerts in Denmark, Germany, and Spain. His first single, "Federico," secured airplay on P4 and a major profile interview in Heartbeats. On Victor's second single, "Too Gorgeous," the string ensemble WHO KILLED BAMBI collaborates.

name: Asbjørn
description:
The Danish pop rebel Asbjørn is one of a kind. An indie darling with a wildcard to the mainstream. In his pop laboratory, where polyrhythms, melancholia, and electronic playfulness collide, Asbjørn stands firmly and remains true to himself. And it works - both Lykke Li and Tessa have praised his talent, and in 2022 Asbjørn was featured on the single ‘Farver’ with the latter.

His inspiration stretches from classical music and folk, which his parents played when he was a child, to Destiny’s Child, Britney, and Michael Jackson, whose songs he used to choreograph dance routines to when he came home from school.

Asbjørn's latest album, ‘Boyology’ (2022), featured collaborations with PC Music’s Danny L Harle (Charli XCX, Caroline Polachek, Dua Lipa) and Planningtorock (Lady Gaga, Robyn). The follow-up is scheduled for release in 2024.

name: Bavé
description:
Grammy-winning Bavé is exactly what the Swedish music scene needs right now. With the ability to blend psychedelic R&B with melancholic indie, this multifaceted artist has created a completely unique sound – praised by international tastemakers such as The Independent, Clash and Earmilk.

The debut EP, ‘In Vermouth’, was released in the fall of 2021, inviting listeners to dive deep into Bavé's magical universe. Falsetto vocals are mixed with pulsating R&B rhythms, soft melodies, and stylish guitar riffs, resulting in an absolutely fantastic debut.

Shortly after a celebrated performance at Way Out West in Gothenburg in 2022, the follow-up EP ‘All Stars Aligned’ was released. It was quickly picked up by The Independent and led to a sold-out headline gig at Debaser Strand in Stockholm. ‘All Stars Aligned’ later won both a Swedish Grammy and the Manifest Gala award for "Årets Soul/RNB" (Soul/R&B of the Year).

name: Charlotte-Amalie feat. Who Killed Bambi
description: Charlotte-Amalie plays Danish cinematic pop with roots in film score composition. Her beautiful pieces exist within a cinematic piano universe, which for this SPOT-performance will be joined by the string ensemble Who Killed Bambi. Together they will paraphrase songs from the songwriters upcoming debut album (september 2024). With Charlotte-Amalie’s powerful vocals up front, we are presented with an account of how love, depression, hope and dreams can shape our lives.

name: Han Herman
description:
Just a year and a half after his debut, Han Herman is celebrated as one of Norway's most exciting new artists. This pop phenomenon has made a huge impression with several live performances on Norway’s main tv-station NRK. He has also provided sparkling support for Matt Corby at a sold-out concert at Sentrum Scene in Oslo, and last fall, he was one of the finalists for "Årets Urørt" on NRK P3. 

Han Herman receives massive praise for his voice, for his songs, and for the exciting originality in his productions. He is innovative and timeless at the same time. He sings about prejudice and intolerance, about standing up for each other regardless of sexual orientation, ethnicity or religion. About not looking away, and taking a stand. Onstage Han Herman - and his band - is on fire! His unique looks and style intertwine with his energetic movements and dancing - and create excitement in audiences of all ages.

name: Night Fever
description:
Night Fever is an explosion of aggressive, musical anger. It's Danish hardcore punk at its finest, led by an intense lead singer and supreme guitar riffs. Night Fever brings the essence of recklessness to their live concerts and is infamous in the underground scene for their play-like-it's-life-or-death hardcore punk. And it's something that must be experienced live.

Their latest album, ‘Dead End’, was released in February on SVART RECORDS.

name: BÆNCH
description:
With guitars hanging below their belt buckles and brand new material up their sleeves, BÆNCH guarantees an intense and strikingly energetic show. The young post-punk/rock band explores a moody and dynamic rock sound with dark guitar elements and expressive synth layers. BÆNCH ventures into a new, authentic sound, welcoming the audience to let loose with a longing and distorted vocal and an energetic tempo.

Their latest single 'Skipped A Step' was released in March in conjunction with the announcement of a spring tour, taking them to more than 20 venues across Denmark.

name: Gadekær x Kaika
description:
Recipe for a concert with Gadekær X Kaika:

  • 2 artists
  • 1 tiger made of wood
  • 1 octopus
  • 10 female singers
  • 1 kg beats
  • A dash of harmonies
  • Tender melodies
  • Matters of the heart

Mix it all together well and serve with beer, friends, and a great atmosphere.

In the spring of 2023, the electro-pop duo Gadekær debuted with the EP 'Over Kæret'. Now, the music takes on a new sound as 10 powerful female voices from the vocal group Kaika join them on stage. Kaika and Gadekær come together in an atmospheric concert where the music is interpreted through choral works combined with synthesizers, samples, and drum machines.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music.

name: Kejser
description:
Kejser cultivates the glamorous and truly ugly because it is in the collisions that stories arise and reality reveals itself. Nothing is done halfway when Kejser takes the stage and plays their quirky and sensual pop music.

Kejser has performed a series of concerts in Copenhagen including venues such as Loppen, Lille Vega, Frigjort Festival, and an exclusive showcase concert in Brooklyn, New York. Most recently, Kejser played a concert to celebrate their debut album at a sold-out Basement in Vesterbro. The media side33 wrote about the concert, "it is rare to experience a lead singer with such a natural performance gene and presence on stage."

In November 2023, Kejser released their debut album 'Drømmen På Plakaten', which was produced in collaboration with star producer Anders Boll (Ganger, Lowly, among others).

name: Mazivila
description: The name behind Mazivila is Steffen Mazivila. He is a Danish/Mozambican singer, songwriter, and producer. He attended MGK in Holstebro and was born and raised in Randers. Steffen has experimented with music throughout most of his life through dance, poetry, musicals, rap, and singing. In 2017, he was named "Ugens Kanon" (the week's cannon) on DR's Karrierekanonen with the song "Sådan her?" ("Like This?"). Life happened and Mazivila had to start over from scratch. Now he performs with his self-written and produced songs, offering a sound that blends pop, EDM, world music, soul, and hip-hop. Come and experience a concert where the music soars in the skies and touches down to earth with delicious grooves and moving lyrics when Mazivila takes the stage.

name: Tigeroak
description:
Tigeroak bridges the gap between easily accessible smooth soul and experimental jazz energy. With their energetic grooves, melodic choruses, and figurative lyrics, everyone is welcome.

Behind the complex rhythms, intricate melodies, and surprising electronic effects are producer and sound artist Laurits Steen Møberg and vocalist Anna Prinds. The Aarhus-based duo released their debut album ‘Living and Living’ on April Records in 2023. The album is a collage of hip-hop grooves from the London underground, 00s neosoul, and electronically futuristic landscapes, combined with cool Nordic elegance and poetic lyrics.

Tigeroak recently won ‘Single of the Year’ at the DMA Jazz awards and has a previous nomination for ‘Innovative Concert Experience of the Year’. Their debut album was recorded at Abbey Road in London, and the duo has taken their music to Beijing, Paris, Berlin, and most recently New York.

name: Ultraflex
description: Ultraflex creates a flamboyant audio-visual world inspired by disco, funk and tongue-in-cheek tasteless aesthetics. The duo’s material is both kitsch and conceptual – pushed through a contemporary pop culture filter. Ultraflex creates their own brand new lotion carefully tailored to your needs. Ultraflex started out drawing tons of inspiration from Soviet and Eastern European electronic music from the 80s, especially Estonian synth-funk producer Uku Kuut, while playing around with old Soviet aerobic videos as visuals for their concerts. On their album ‘Infinite Wellness’ (2022), the sources of inspiration include International Music System, Master C & J and Alice Deejay.

name: USERS
description: USERS is an emerging post-punk band that has quickly sent shockwaves through the Danish music scene. Rooted in socially critical activism, the fight for a new society is manifested through noisy riffs, aggressive vocals and thought-provoking lyrics. The music is a wake-up call you can dance to, and there will be plenty of opportunity to do so as USERS present hope among frustrations at a fast pace. Despite the band's short lifespan, they have unequivocally proven, through their uncompromising, explosive, and sharp live shows, that they fill a void in the music scene.

name: Sara Parkman
description:
Sara Parkman is a folk musician known for both questioning and embracing traditions in such a brazen yet thought-provoking manner that she has created her own musical universe. In this way, she has become a prominent figure in modern Swedish folk music.

The music from her three acclaimed solo albums has reverberated from the misty depths of Nordic forests during nocturnal rave parties to blasting out of speakers in various live performances on popular TV programs. When her latest album, ‘Eras Agape Philia’ was released in October 2022, it was met with overwhelming reviews. The album marked Sara Parkman's breakthrough, earning her a Swedish Grammy and sitting at the top of the album chart of the largest Swedish newspaper, Dagens Nyheter, for no less than five weeks.

Over the years, Sara Parkman has received multiple awards, and in addition to her album success, she has had several completely sold-out tours and also hosted the TV show ‘Jill's Veranda’ in Nashville.

name: Laura Bugtrup
description: From the room in her childhood home in Herning, thoughtful lyrics and melancholic melodies emerge from young singer/songwriter Laura Bugtrup, blending together into soulful songs that observe the world and its people. In a sound universe of indie folk, acoustic guitar, ambient electric guitar, and a powerful vocal merge into a mood that feels both otherworldly and incredibly close. With her words at her command, Laura and her band take the listener on a journey out into the world and back home again.

name: Omar
description:
Omar has had an extraordinary musical journey.At the age of 9-10, he released songs on YouTube and gained local fame under the name Omar Nr1Bandit. It was clear early on that he would continue making music. In 2017, he released his first single under the name Omar and quickly gained popularity due to his unique vocals and minimalist UK productions. In a time dominated by gritty street rap in the Danish urban scene, Omar stood out as a breath of fresh air. Stories of rising from the bottom sounded more adventurous and less dangerous in Omar's unique packaging.

After more than 15 singles and an EP, Omar took a short break from music to rediscover himself. When he returned from his self-imposed hiatus, the productions were more significant and the sound more pop-oriented. He found a new look and sound that was both authentic and forward-looking. At the same time, his ambitions with music grew bigger. It's no longer enough for Omar to demonstrate that he can create music that streams well. Omar wants to prove that his music is ready for the live stage.  It's a side of Omar that people haven't seen yet. He is finally ready to unfold and tell his entire story.

name: SKINZ
description:
For nearly a decade, SKINZ has established himself as one of the country's most successful and most played pop artists. With outstanding charisma, a unique sound, and numerous nationwide hits like 'Malibu' and 'Jeg har en pige', SKINZ has made his mark on the Danish music scene and created soundtracks for an entire generation.
Ambition is a cornerstone of SKINZ's way of evolving as an artist, and now he is delving even deeper into his musical universe and renewing the live experience, with a focus on creating a colorful show, party vibes, and a dynamic concert experience.

For SPOT, SKINZ will debut his brand new live show, marking the beginning of the Danish pop star's next chapter, which promises plenty of new music in 2024. It will be a new and more mature musical journey, with the first glimpses being the most recent singles like 'Alfabet', '00'er Pige', and most recently 'Chancen', which with its organic, funky, and groovy vibes, brings to mind both Bruno Mars' 'Uptown Funk' and Justin Timberlake x Pharrell's single 'Like I Love You'. 'Chancen' has topped TikTok in Denmark among the most used tracks, just like the 2023 single 'Senorita', which made the Top 10 in 2023 among the most used tracks on the social media platform in Denmark.

We look forward to welcoming you to a huge show with SKINZ at SPOT 2024.

name: The Jürgen Clubs
description:
The Jürgen Clubs was created in 2022, when Magnus Grilstad and the brothers Victor and Julius Schack - from the successful live bands Heimatt and Alcabean - decided to create a new and fun universe. Later on Sebastian Toft joined the group, and together they have constructed a unique world within the self conceptualized genre jacuzzi-rock.

‘Jacuzzi’ is the equivalent to relaxation, sunshine, warmth, inflatable pool toys and last but not least; holiday. On holiday, you don’t take yourself too seriously. You lower your guard, meet new people and drink an extra cocktail, letting out all the pent up emotions and awkward anecdotes. And in many ways, this is exactly the essence of The Jürgen Clubs, according to the frontman of the group, Magnus Grilstad.

Since The Jürgen Clubs released their first single ‘You Never Take Me Anywhere, James’ (2022) the informal indie rockers have established themselves on the Danish music scene with their catchy, energetic and humoristic tracks. GAFFA highlighted the band in the annual piece ‘De bliver store’ (“The Next Big Thing”), and P6 Beat have been playing the singles ‘Shiver’ and ‘Daddy Was a Player’ more than 400 times.

name: IDA KUDO
description:
IDA KUDO challenges societal expectations, finds her inner voice, and stays true to herself on her upcoming EP 'Proud' (April 2024). The music promises a sophisticated pop package with experimental grooves and powerful choruses. Blending an authentic and organic sound with catchy melodies, IDA KUDO's music is edgy, whimsical, and filled with strong feminine power, drawing inspiration from artists like St. Vincent, Fiona Apple, and Kimbra. Growing up in Denmark with a Danish father and Japanese mother, IDA KUDO incorporates influences from her ethnic roots, creating a unique Scandinavian-Asian mix with a British touch in production, alongside Andrew Hunt. The result is an eclectic blend, embracing hip-hop attitude, 50s orchestration, and vocals ranging from graceful harmonies to chanting tribal choirs. All wrapped up in solid pop with a powerful vocal at the forefront.

IDA KUDO's music has been featured on BBC Introducing, DR P3, P4, and P6 BEAT, as well as on radio channels in Germany and France. Several of her previous releases, such as 'Gold,' 'Jinx,' and 'Wolf,' have been used in TV series like Netflix's 'Selling Sunset' and in major international campaigns for brands such as Starbucks, Victoria's Secret, and Audi.

name: Lightchapter
description:
Lightchapter plays what they call Electro Death Metal. They draw their inspiration from a myriad of unlikely sources, such as classic melodic death metal, the synthwave genre, and soundscapes from 80s sci-fi and action films. This results in a primal and angry yet sophisticated and grandiose sound from the four-man Aarhus-based band, who found their final form and style during the pandemic.

Their debut album ‘TIME TO OBEY’ was recorded in 2023 and has garnered Lightchapter over 280.000 streams on Spotify and presence on several playlists on leading streaming services.

With a captivating and energetic stage show, Lightchapter invites the audience on a journey into their unique and otherworldly sci-fi metal universe.

name: ALOO
description: ALOO is the experimental electro-pop solo project of multi-instrumentalist and producer Sofie Søe. In 2023 she released her second EP ‘Berlin’, following her critically acclaimed debut ‘FØR’. ALOO’s stories are shared and unapologetically delivered by her sensitive yet powerful vocal on top of a rich blend of synthesizers, drum machines and cinematic string arrangements.

name: AySay
description: With life in two cultures as a starting point, AySay unfolds stories about the entirety of two halves. In October, the trio released their second album 'KÖY,' following the critically acclaimed debut 'Su Akar' from 2021. The second single from the new album is 'Ez Kevokim,' AySay's interpretation of a beloved Kurdish folk song of the same name. Joining the song is musician Ozan Demir, playing the Anatolian wind instrument zurna, and lead singer Luna Ersahin wrote the lyrics as a tribute to the women of the Iranian revolution. During the fall of 2023, AySay toured Denmark, Germany and France as part of their 'KÖY Release Tour' in connection with the release of the new album.

name: Deb Foam
description: Copenhagen-based producer Deb Foam has dedicated herself to using music and sound as a way to express and cope with the often overwhelming emotions that can be difficult to identify and articulate. Her productions are characterized by their aggressive and heavy sound, which reflects themes of vengeance, hopelessness, and rage that run throughout her work. Despite the intensity of these themes, there is also a sense of playfulness and experimentation in Deb Foam's music as she continues to search for new ways to channel and release her inner world through sound. Whether through her live performances or recorded work, Deb Foam remains committed to using music as a means of self-expression and healing.

name: Von Quar
description:
After establishing himself as the fiercest drummer at Viborg Stadium, he now steps into the spotlight and fulfills his own creative vision as Von Quar.

Von Quar writes Danish-language hooligan-rock music with a universe of hypnotic synths, hard-hitting drums, and loud vocals from the national sport. Von Quar pulls you into an electronic hooligan rave party, with a nod to punk and its rawness - while also immersing you in the hopeful atmosphere of catchy melodies and Bon Iver-inspired vocals.

name: WILDR
description:
The new, Copenhagen-based quintet, WILDR, is a search for vitality through tenderness, high tempo and raw desperation, drawing from a wide range of genres, such as hardcore and dream pop. WILDR's manifesto is that of an emotional and energetic love storm. The belief that love can be found in the middle of mosh pits.

Formed in 2023 by Anders Hvass and Mathias Smidt, WILDR is based on a desire to create meaning and heartfelt connection between people. Through the first concerts, WILDR has already established a reputation for being a deeply engrossing, bitingly intense live experience.

name: BRITZ
description:
Hip hop is often quite uncompromising in its style, and those with good stories to tell rise to the top quicker. Therefore, it is unsurprising that BRITZ is observed in those heights - a rapper with truthful stories about feelings and experiences. By challenging and exploring multiple identities, BRITZ has consistently delivered heavy yet sensitive rap that strikes a chord and bears witness to multiple cultures intersecting - and succeeding.

It is exactly this mix of cultures that makes the hard-hitting, flowing hip hop of BRITZ unforgettable.
