The sound of BRITZ fuses elements from melodic Ghanaian gospel, bone-chilling modern hip hop and several analogue instruments in the mix both on and off stage to create an eclectic and comprehensive soundscape, representative of everything BRITZ is; a winner, a fellow human being, a brother, a son, a social worker and a storyteller. And everything is done independently, in a music industry that is dynamic and constantly changing. The music is difficult to pigeonhole, and embraces a wide range of sounds and themes - but most of all, it tells stories from growing up, guides the young and honors the cultural background of the rapper, who turns 30 this year. It is guaranteed to formally be "BRITZ Szn" for the whole of 2024.

name: Emil Palme
description:
Emil Palme is an experimental composer and guitarist whose practice is rooted in Scandinavian folklore and experimental music. Stroking and scratching the strings of his instrument with self-made bows of stone, the Danish artist conjures mesmerizing ceremonial patterns which unfold in the misty nether zone between composition and improvisation.

There is a primeval quality to the music, and a vital simplicity which begs comparison to certain stark turns by Morton Feldman or more recently the Malone/O’Malley coalition.

name: Holdo
description:
Holdo is a brand new Danish electronic artist who, apart from their support gig for Kind mod Kind at a sold-out Pumpehuset in March, has neither released music nor performed concerts before now. With an ambition to embrace both the broad and the narrow – performing at major festivals and DJ sets at underground clubs – Holdo creates organic electronic music that explores and hovers around the borderland between house, pop, and electronica. 

The debut single 'Alene' is the first taste of Holdo's sound. The song is woven into a sample of Clara Rose's vocals from her and USSEL’s double single 'Bag Tapet' and it’s the first single from Holdo’s debut EP, which will be released this summer.

name: maenske
description:
maenske is Danish groove-pop, expressing deeply processed feelings through poetry, with the broad brush strokes of philosophical introspection.

Thomas Tornvig is the artist behind maenske, who since 2016 has been working on finding the sound and identity most in tune with his work as a musician. The result of this labor is maenske, a project which took its first steps in the summer of 2022.

Thoughts of impermanence and never ending feelings of longing are subjects in the lyrics. maenske is the sound of ambivalence, struggle and the belief that through each other, we can experience timeless existence. Combined with the artist’s 80s-inspired soundscapes of grooves and synthesizers, the show will fill you with ecstasy and a sensation of being in a trance. Just for a moment. You will return home with a feeling of being understood as the human being (maenske/menneske) you are.

name: Neon Priest
description:
Supersonically weaving through elements drawn from trance, eurodance, hyperpop and straight out EDM, Neon Priest assert themselves on exploring and pushing the boundaries within electronic pop music. With a weighty heritage of references derived from the ecstasy and carefree nature of the late 2000’s and early 2010’s, the work of Neon Priest manages to evoke the grand emotions of escapism and club-euphoria.

A trance-pop love child wouldn’t be an insufficient description of the Copenhagen-based quartet, who guested last year's SPOT Festival and recently released their powerhouse club tune ‘Bandage Toss’. When performing their high-energy live shows, Neon Priest are on a quest to dissolve time and space, ceaselessly renewing and reinterpreting their own works, while immersing you into their pulsating biome.

name: Rosa Anschütz
description:
Rosa Anschütz is a twenty-six-year-old singer-songwriter and artist based in Berlin, Germany. Seeking to transform daily observations and interrogations into hauntingly beautiful and crafted records, her poetic and sharp lyrics oscillate between singing and spoken words in distinctively emotionally driven combinations of electronic music and analog instruments.
At SPOT you will get the chance to hear some of her new music. ‘Interior’, her third solo album, was released early 2024, and is Rosa Anschütz’s most introspective and vulnerable album to date; an insightful and powerfully crafted album which dives within but also urges to turn to the outside.

The record operates as a meditative sonic and lyrical journey across genres, with an analog dark-romanticism rooted in the melancholia of neo-folk, the elegance and solemnity of modern classic and the grace and baroque of sacred music.

Along the nine tracks of the record, this faith is looked for within the difficult lessons of heartbreak, natural beauty, family ghosts, the mysticism of spirituality.
It is partly found in the traverse flute, the trumpet and the organ. The instruments emphasize Anschütz’s cold and delicate singing and reciting, the entirely analog composition of ‘Interior’ setting Rosa’s voice and lyrics as the genuine backbone of the album.

It establishes Rosa Anschütz as a stunningly talented artist, poet and singer-songwriter, whose sharpness gives her the courage to look at what lies within herself to then dare you to look at what she is, at last, observing.

name: TELUS
description: TELUS is a young Danish post-punk group that takes the stage with raw emotions. In the borderlands between post-punk, alternative, and pop, an emotional vocal merges with hard-hitting drums, catchy melodies, and atmospheric soundscapes. The band has created a dynamic sound that encompasses uplifting melodies, heavier shoegaze-inspired pieces, and large vulnerable ballads about life.

name: Tiger På Spring
description:
The energetic party-punk band Tiger På Spring writes catchy tunes in English about despair and hope, conflict and mystery. And it's a band that must be experienced live. Through partial improvisation and close contact with the audience, the concert experience becomes the connection between the explorer and the danger lurking in the jungle. With carefully woven lyrical universes and melodic signatures that recur across the songs, the whole gains a greater conceptual and spiritual authority.

The single 'Jerusalem' was recommended by DR's KarriereKanonen, and their latest release 'Violent Heart' (2023) was released on Celebration Records, serving as a fine representation of Tiger På Spring's live expression, which has caught the interest of GAFFA among others.

name: LIFESICK
description:
Inspired by elements of Swedish death metal, LIFESICK creates an authentic and explosive blend of crushing tones and modern breakdowns. The result is an uncompromising sound with brutally honest songs and lyrics that delve into the turbulent nature of life.

LIFESICK recently signed a record deal with Metal Blade Records and are now ready with their brand new EP 'Love and Other Lies', consisting of the three tracks ‘Every Unpleasant Emotion’, ‘Rude Awakening’, and ‘Reverse Birth’. The new EP is produced and mixed by Jacob Bredahl at Dead Rat Studio, mastered by Brad Boatright at Audiosiege, and was released earlier this year.

name: Girls in Airports x Teitur
description:
The Faroese songwriter Teitur reinterprets Faroese folk music in collaboration with the Danish indie-jazz band Girls in Airports. The project, which began back in 2022, premiered at VEGA in Copenhagen and has since evolved into an album produced by the international producer Bruce Lampcov, scheduled for release later this year.

The motivation is to preserve and renew Faroese Skjaldur - one of the cornerstones of Faroese culture. These folk songs are at the core of the music. As a reflection of Teitur's childhood in the Faroe Islands and his youth in Denmark, the material is based on old Faroese rhymes and melodies, which he and Girls in Airports have reinterpreted in radically new directions, drawing on genres such as jazz, electronic, and indie.

With two Danish Grammy Awards, over 1000 concerts, and 8 studio albums under his belt, Teitur has proven his talent for capturing the listener in an intense and seductive grip.

Girls in Airports distinguish themselves with an enormous openness to genre, sound, and expression and are in many ways ambassadors for new jazz. Collective creativity is a big part of the group's DNA, and in recent years they have immersed themselves in artistic collaborations, which, in addition to the collaboration with Teitur, has resulted in the ambitious work 'Leap' composed for Aarhus Jazz Orchestra.

name: Nusantara Beat
description: Nusantara Beat's commitment to honoring the traditions of their Indonesian roots and cultural heritage is only part of their mission. The six-man band from Amsterdam strives to showcase the immense diversity of Indonesian music and propel it into the future. By adding their own innovative twists to the mix, they celebrate the traditional sounds while introducing a fresh and modern perspective.

name: Ponny
description:
Ponny is a newly formed band from Aarhus, situated at the intersection of princess punk and dad rock. The band consists of Laura Maj Zeuthen (bass/vocals), Anna Raaber (guitar/vocals), and Asta Rebien (drums), who, with their chemistry and humorous lyrics, craft an inclusive and engaging concert experience. Ponny's songs touch upon themes such as feminine rage, haunting memories, and human consumption, all while diving into the noise with vocals that are as furious as they are liberating. 

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: pære banal
description:
pære banal is a post-punk trio based in Copenhagen. Comprised of energetic and angular tunes driven forward by off-kilter riffs, staccato beats, and distorted vocals; their music evokes an uncontrollable urge to ride your bike as fast as you can, and whilst at full speed; have a laugh at the absurdities of status quo.

With their uniformized live concerts and tight interplay pære banal brings an unmatched energy to their live shows, with unexpected breaks and abrupt tempo changes that leave listeners in a confused euphoria.

name: GUZO
description: GUZO is the name of the new ambitious English-language solo project by August Fogh. The sound of GUZO is a blend of Bon Iver, 070 Shake, and 90s grunge. The universe is as contrasting as it is distinctive. The debut single 'RADICAL' is a prime example of the raw universe that constitutes GUZO's sound. The song is a captivating and hard-hitting midnight anthem to the wild and unfiltered, offering the first taste of the upcoming debut album. However, August is not new to the Danish music scene. His talent for songwriting and ability to seamlessly navigate between genres have made him one of the country's most sought-after songwriters. He has written for prominent Danish artists such as Jada, Artigeardit, and Phlake. Additionally, August has previously been a part of the soul-pop project Soon, which gained significant popularity with 'Ashes' from the duo's debut album (2022).

name: Smag På Dig Selv
description: A drummer and two saxophonists. That's the simple recipe for one of the wildest live bands in the Nordic region. It tastes like punk, it tastes like jazz, a bit of pop, hip-hop, afro-beat, and perhaps some 90s dance. The trio from Christianshavn, Smag På Dig Selv, embodies instrumental euphoria – dangerous, forward-thinking, seductive, and free. The three friends joined their saxophones and drums in 2018 with a vision to kick people onto the dance floor and push the boundaries of the typical concert experience and genre understanding. The big question before experiencing Smag På Dig Selv is: When was the last time you headbanged at a jazz concert?

name: Yaeger
description:
Yaeger has gradually, since her debut, moved towards infectious rave-pop from electronic pop-R&B.

In late 2023, she released the energetic single 'Water Pistol', which sounds like nothing else. With minimal means, Yaeger manages to make a pop song sound powerful by allowing her vocals to function as an additional instrument, pumping with almost violent beats in symbiosis with the rhythm. Recently, Yaeger released the equally energetic collaboration with Icona Pop, 'Shit We Do For Love', and most notably the stylish 'Lupins In Blue'. This is a new sound from one of the most interesting artists on the Swedish scene right now, and a musical experience to look forward to experiencing live.

name: Østen
description: For many, the Aarhus-based artist Østen is a blank slate, but in collaboration with producer Frederik Thaae, he has played a role as a songwriter on albums such as Artigeardit's 'Længe Leve' and Barcelona's 'Væbnet Hjerte'. Now, Østen has embarked on his solo career and, in early January 2024, he released his debut single 'Regn,' which received acclaim on Soundvenue, entered directly as the 'Ugens Uundgåelig' on P3, and ranked in the top 5 most Shazamed songs in Denmark. The music evokes a magical blend of Sivas and Sebastian, and on stage, the audience will experience Østen's presence and vulnerability as the organic constellation of musicians performs his songs.

name: GRETA
description:
Look forward to escaping boredom with Denmark's new synth queen when GRETA invites you into her glittering and raved electropop universe. With releases like 'Hydrogen,' 'Again,' 'Vibrant,' and 'Forever We'll Be Dancing' in recent years, she has become one of the most talked-about upcoming names at home and a bit of a darling among reviewers.

GRETA creates magical pop music, driven by nostalgia and inspired by the future, captivating listeners with her prominent 80s synths and electronic grooves. Her latest singles like 'Wonder,' 'Nicht Allein,' and 'Out of Mind' make you yearn for the club scene. Her bright vocals move within intricate pop bubbles, while the weight is felt in her lyrics about existential thoughts, leaving room for both light and darkness. Her adventurous and assertive synthpop is complemented by a tight visual aesthetic, immersing the spectator in a euphoric universe where surrendering to the beat and dance is inevitable. The hype surrounding GRETA as a phenomenal live act has spread like wildfire among both the audience and critics - something to look forward to experiencing at SPOT 2024.

name: Antistatic
description: Antistatic play a trance-inducing fusion of minimalism, ambient music and heavy metal. Following the EP ‘Drop Dive Breach’, Antistatic released their first full length album ‘RELICS’ through the renowned US label Cuneiform Records early 2024. Within the album, Antistatic investigate rhythm, patience and musical hierarchies with equal amounts of curiosity and intent. The instrumental music of Antistatic redefines traditional band concepts by employing guitars as percussion instruments and allowing the drums to sing in feedbacking disharmony. The four musicians reclaim the repetitive work usually given over to machines, using this work as a calibration of the mind. The use of repetition allows the listeners and the players to immerse themselves fully into the depths of the rhythms.

name: The Afterparty
description:
After the concerts in Volume Village, we're ready to end the friday with a beautiful SPOT afterparty

Wasabi (DJ)
Wasabi always pursues to create the right vibe, selecting each tune sincere to her heart & soul. With her eclectic style, she will take you on a sonic journey with a mix of sugary, spicy, and bouncy beats, with roots from all over the world. 

Faza (Concert)

FIA (DJ)
FIA, the Aarhus based DJ that is a part of the collective LYC - "Love your Connections", has a mission:  With her focus behind the deck, FIA will transform dancefloors into pulsating realms of pure energy. Surrender to the allure of her handpicked and enchanting mixes, as she crafts a sonic journey that resonates within your hips and knees. Get ready to lose yourself in the labyrinth of sound, guided by FIA's expert curation and boundless creativity.

name: The Bird
description: With extravagant MIDI landscapes, The Bird combines electronic styles such as dubstep and eurodance, inviting the listener into a world of bizarre narratives. Since the release of the debut single ‘Boing Boing’ in 2022, Yunus Rosenzweig has released two EPs under the alias The Bird and engaged in various collaborations with other musicians, visual artists, and fashion brands. The Bird's concerts are of extreme intensity, and there is not one quiet moment along the way.

name: EMIL
description:
Strap on your helmet! Or take it off? when EMIL lets you into a universe of burnout, frustration and resignation. There’s no time to waste, when all the idiots need to be told what absolute assholes they are, and it will be sentimental when EMIL finds that he might be the asshole after all. EMIL wraps punk energy and gutter poetry in pop music and calls it indulgence pop. Music you can unplug your brain and dance to, while also reckoning with your feelings.

At the moment, EMIL is finishing up his debut EP in collaboration with Peter Kjædegaard (The Minds of 99, Nephew) which will be released in september 2024.

Join us for a therapy session with EMIL, where it’s the bum and not the social worker setting the order of the day.

name: Joalin
description: The 22-year old artist, singer and songwriter Joalin, who is also known from her exceptional dancing skills and heartwarming social media platforms, finished her 2022 with a bang by releasing her debut EP ‘I’m The One’ which set a new sound to the world. The sound is a head-on narrative of Joalin and who she is: the mixture of her melancholy Finnish Nordic side meeting the spanish latin influences that she grew up with and was surrounded by. After her debut EP gaining multiple NMF spots, MTV music video debuts and millions of streams, Joalin is ready to take over the world and you can expect songs full of creativity, surprising collabs and captivating melodies.

name: BUKHAR presents Berrin Bas
description: With roots in Turkey, DJ Berrin Bas creates a sound landscape that will make your hips sway and your back bend. A sound landscape that combines Danish and Turkish roots, and is filled with everything she grew up with and around. Turkish çiftetellis, arabesque, disco, pop, ballads, trap, and techno—you name it, all from the SWANA regions.

name: PANA RADIO AFTERPARTY
description: Antoine and Ramiro are members of the Aarhus based platform Pana Radio and have a deep love for dance- and club music. Coming from different styles and genres, this is not your typical match up. The pair have found a connection through their shared love for groovy tech- and deep house, rolling basslines and soulful chords. Expect a groove filled DJ-set with hints of breaks and garage.

name: WIINSTON
description:
Singer Daniel Richards and producer Alfred Thomas have ever since they started making music together been delivering consistently high levels of quality, rarely seen in the Danish music scene. The duo quickly gained attention internationally with the singles ‘Canada’ and ‘Mio’, which immediately got them signed by the legendary Nate Albert at Capitol Records U.S. (The Weeknd, Maggie Rogers and more) and got attention from several prominent international music blogs. 

WIINSTON made their live debut with a five star show at SPOT Festival and the same year played their debut headline show for a completely packed Hotel Cecil and a full tent at Musik i Lejet. Since then WIINSTON has sold out all their headline shows, with and without a full line-up behind them. Earlier this year, the Danish R&B-duo released their third album ‘THE LAST DAYTONA’ which once again demonstrates their no-compromise and genre-bending approach. Their soundscapes are vulnerable and honest, supported by a cinematic dimension which is set free in their always well-executed visuals. 

Ever since the music project was kickstarted, WIINSTON has released cinematic pop bangers, bursting with atmospheric R&B, Folk and Hiphop, wrapped in an aesthetic and thought through visual frame.

name: LIFT OFF Day Party
description:
The independent agency LIFT OFF ensures that you kick off your SPOT Saturday in the finest way with a day party at Radar. Here you can experience:

Hvalfugl
Trembling musical presence, ambient sounds, and strong melodies come together in perfect harmony when the trio Hvalfugl takes the stage.

Astrid Engberg
The Copenhagen based singer, producer, composer, and DJ Astrid Engberg, released her second album 'Trust' in September 2023. Astrid Engberg's music spans modern soul, R&B, nu jazz, and modern classical music

Elias Rønnenfelt
Known for his work as the lead vocalist of the critically acclaimed band Iceage, Rønnenfelt has carved a unique path in the realm of alternative rock and post-punk, pushing boundaries and challenging conventions with each release.

Smag På Dig Selv
A drummer and two saxophonists. That's the simple recipe for one of the wildest live bands in the Nordic region. It tastes like punk, it tastes like jazz, a bit of pop, hip-hop, afro-beat, and perhaps some 90s dance.

name: Prime Music Day Party
description:
Prime Music invites you to a Day Party on May 4th as part of the partner program at SPOT Festival 2024. For the first time, the agency opens its doors for an afternoon filled with their young talents, treating the audience to a taste of their music.

Accompanied by a house band consisting of "Young" Jens Michael Østergaard and Mads "The Bass" Ebbesen, the audience will be taken on a musical journey through various genres, including pop, hip-hop, and afrobeats. Experience performances by Føns, Tarick, Niko Blonde, Mowgli, William Quist, KAKA, Tjida, and Sebastian Wibe.

Prime Music is an independent booking agency founded in the year 2000. Based in the heart of Copenhagen, they send out more than 3000 shows every year, ranging from festivals and venues to nightclubs and high schools. The agency is known for its commitment to honesty, accessibility, and innovation in the music industry.

With a packed program, there's a guarantee of great musical experiences from start to finish. 

The event is presented in collaboration with G-shock and Dansk Event Teknik

name: DiGiDi Day Party
description:
Get ready for a magical day with DiGiDi Dayparty at SPOT, where young talents Clean Out Louis, Filuka and SPEEDY will present their music.

Clean Out Louis is a Danish alternative pop duo inspired by artists like Gorillaz, Thom Yorke, and David Bowie. Sylvester Zabello and Mingus Runge strive to be a remarkable live act, aiming to create a unique atmosphere no matter where or when they perform.

Filuka, with her lyrical universe and captivating live performance, emerges among the most promising hip hop names in Denmark. Her career began in the Copenhagen hip hop underground scene in 2017. Fiona Celeste Spang Bergsøe is known for her unique sound, blending energetic hip-hop with lightly spiced warm tones from soul and reggae.

In the heart of Aarhus V, where everyday life can be marked by challenges, a remarkable musical talent has emerged. Singer SPEEDY has managed to stand out and let his voice be heard through honest and authentic music. Through his music, he conveys the life of a young person in a socially challenged area in both festive and reflective ways.

name: Projekt Livsværker
description: Projekt Livsværker is the result of a meeting between emerging talents and individuals with stories that become more manageable to share, when others convey them through songwriting. With the North Jutlandic singer-songwriter Andreas Rødbro leading the project, conversations turn into new works that, based on life experiences, focus on the ups and downs of life. Therefore, the focal point becomes life stories that can surprise, encourage, and provide food for thought. The project highlights the importance of being allowed to tell one's story.

name: Damkapellet
description:
Featuring Randi Pontoppidan, Kirstine Lindemann, Pauline Hogstrand and Greta Eacott

Damkapellet is a professional musician and composer collective with a mission to create diversity on the Danish music scene. They perform music by women, non-binary and trans people and experiment with collective co-creation of music based in art music - from improvisation to opera to performance. 

Composer, vocalist and performer Randi Pontoppidan (b. 1970) is, among other things, known for her experimental mix of vocal work and electronic live processing of the voice. In her work 'DEMIURGE', Pontoppidan explores the demiurge, who is the Platonic and Gnostic deity who shapes the material world, based on her voice and Damkapellet's instrumentation.

With a particular interest in the body and movement, the work of instrumentalist, composer and performer Kirstine Lindemann (b. 1987) revolves around the space between you and me. With the orchestra, Lindemann has prepared a version of 'Further & Back', which includes the musicians' voice and breathing and adds a primitiveness and physicality to the piece.

Violaist and composer Pauline Hogstrand implements structures in cyclical and extended forms in her solo works. The work 'Chants' is immediate and bodily, a musical ritual that seeks to meet the audience in both challenging and conciliatory ways, in close co-creation with Damkapellet.

British/Swedish composer Greta Eacott (b. 1990) is known for her uninhibited approach to composition and her experimental percussion works. The work 'Gestalt Minimal III' was composed for Damkapellet in 2020 and although the overall aesthetic can be considered 'dark', the work is a love song that perhaps conveys an alternative point of view on romance.

The concert is part of SPOT FLUX, a collaboration between the Danish Composers' Society and SPOT Festival, which presents new orchestral music in a new setting. SPOT FLUX is presented in collaboration with Art Music Denmark and is supported by the Augustinus Foundation.

name: Lihme
description:
Lihme writes diss tracks disguised as indie pop. With honest lyrics, she explores and tackles unhealthy relationships with an insistence on the right to say: "It's you. Not me". 

Her indie pop draws on musical inspirations such as Lykke Li, Feist, Lydmor, and Oh Land. Lihme moves in a soundscape where hand-played instruments, electronic influences, and an organic aesthetic are given free rein in combination with her Nordic sound and cold synthesizers.

Lihme utilizes her background as a sound designer and artist both in production and live on stage, where she creates atmospheric and captivating experiences by blending sound art and pop music.

Her latest album ‘Solid | Soft’ received a five-star review from GAFFA, and Lihme's music is currently being played on both P3 and P6 Beat.

name: Raymonde Gaunoux
description:
With a strong and heartfelt vocal, Raymonde Gaunoux sings vulnerable, queer songs. Songs full of power, faith, hope, and love. With his inviting and embracing character, he fills the room with moving, authentic, and grandiose music that will undoubtedly find its way to your heart and give you an experience you didn't know you were missing.

The imaginative compositions and vivid lyrics lean into the sound of Prince ballads, David Bowie's quirkiness, and melodious North American indie-folk-rock.

Raymonde advocates for visibility of queer and trans identity in the music industry through his music and has spoken about this in GAFFA - THE QUEER ISSUE. In the summer of 2022, the Danish-French-American musician collaborated with Queer Music Agency and has since performed on the main stage at Copenhagen Pride 2022, VEGA, and RUST, among others. Raymonde will release the EP 'Transitions' on May 22, 2024.

name: Schæfer
description: With whimsical and poetic songs, Schæfer invites you into a world of stories that are both dark and melancholic, bright and whimsical. The duo consisting of Anna Skov Jensen (vocals) and Emil Mors Rasmussen (keyboards), both have roots in the vibrant arts and music scene of Aalborg. Together, they create music that is hard to resist with its distinctive and effortless genre blend of infectious indie pop and playful jazz elements. Through Schæfer's wandering and poetic songs, they address everything from the profound to the banal with lyrics that are both vulnerable and sensory, written with humor and irony. With their band, they manage to create an atmospheric sound universe that pulls the songs in explosive directions.

name: The Three Body Problem
description: The Three Body Problem opens up for strange sensations and is with its cinematic point of departure both grand and minimalistic. The mix between the synthesizer’s futuristic sounds and the tactile melodies of the brass instruments symbolize the dichotomy between nature and culture. In our fast paced world nature is a generous source of calm, while at the same time reminding us of the meaning behind the changes we can see happening around us.

name: Nanna Bottos
description:
Nanna Bottos recently released her debut EP ‘Falling In Love With The World’, about falling back in love with the world after it has broken your heart. The songs all revolve around broken relationships and betrayal. 

Soft synths, sharp guitar figures and acoustic drums carry Nanna’s warm vocals and support melodies that have clearly been written at the piano or the guitar. In addition to writing songs for her own project, Nanna writes songs for other danish and international artists and has recently received gold, platinum and #1 for her work with a number of popular South Korean K-pop artists. 

Nannas debut as a solo artist happens after many years as a member of several musical constellations, including the band Ida Red, with whom she released the hit ‘Wildflower’ in 2018.

name: RÅ
description:
With an unusual lineup, unpredictable arrangements, and a great deal of joy in playing, a close interplay is created when RÅ takes the stage. It is liberatingly free from clichés while simultaneously genuine and well thought out. The predominantly traditional Swedish folk music is dressed in everything from contemporary art music to EDM-inspired riffs, and the result is its very own sound, which feels both brave and refreshing.

The musicians in RÅ combine the melancholic seriousness of the polskas, the suggestive rhythm of the waltzes, and the playful swing of the polkas and create a whole that challenges the listener, while harboring great love and respect for the musical heritage they uphold. With its unusual lineup consisting of violin, clarinet, and saxophone, the sound becomes an exciting and fresh addition to the Nordic music scene.

name: hun_sagde
description:
hun_sagde is hip-hop disguised in grungy pop productions, awakening your inner rebel.

Emma has created a universe where Nordic melancholy takes the stage with an intensity and eye contact that both comforts and scolds. A few improvised dance steps are always thrown in when hun_sagde delivers an unforgettable live performance, maxing out with drum-heavy choruses.

If you were one of the many who saw Zar Paulo live in the fall, you definitely got a taste of hun_sagde, who with explosive live energy, stands out as a name to watch. hun_sagde has also warmed up for both Goss and Patina and has been selected as one of 10 participants for DR’s KarriereKanonen 2024.

name: Lea Eyðbjørg
description: Danish-Faroese Lea Eyðbjørg has quickly attracted attention after having supported August Høyen, Dahlin and others, and now she’s at work taking over the hearts of Denmark with her upcoming debut EP ‘kærlighedsdigte til de uhjælpelige’. From her room in Aarhus she writes songs exploring everyday feelings, which she wraps carefully in nordic pop melodies and captivating choral arrangements.

name: NIMA
description:
This Copenhagen-based artist with deep roots from Iran creates music that is a powerful experience of emotions and relationships. His lyrics are raw and explicit, and his songs explore love, loss, and desire.

NIMA's music fusion combines R&B/soul and live electro-pop with a melancholic yet hopeful twist. His Iranian heritage shines through in the productions, which include samples from old Iranian classics, uniting culture and emotions in catchy melodies and poetic lyrics.

NIMA recently released the singles 'OXYGEN' and 'BRAVE'. He has already taken on larger stages around the country such as the Main Stage at Copenhagen Pride and the stage at the Danish Music Awards 2023. NIMA's EP is set to release in spring 2024.

name: Beinir
description:
From an early age, the 23-year-old Beinir has been playing the guitar and singing for anyone willing to listen. Dreaming of a life filled with music, he left the comfortable and familiar Saltangará to follow his passion in Denmark. Earlier this year, he released his first single ‘Greener’ from the upcoming debut album. The song, written in collaboration with Søren Christensen (The Blue Van, Fallulah, Ameli Dot) and Anders Bønløkke (Zar Paulo, Alphabeat), reached #10 on Danish radio. It is about embracing change and the unknown.

Singer/songwriter Beinir has already played quite a few solo shows, supporting artists such as Jonah Blacksmith, Stine Bramsen, and Dopha, and he has been praised by both GAFFA and Bands of Tomorrow for his live performance. Bands of Tomorrow awarded him 4.5 out of 5 stars for his set at UHØRT, writing: “By himself, Faroese Beinir took to the stage with his guitar and delivered one of the best shows of the night. With impressive guitar playing and a drum pedal, Beinir filled Skatescenen with his amazing singing voice and well-written lyrics.”

name: Døgg Nónsgjógv
description: Døgg Nónsgjógv hails from the Faroe Islands and released the EP 'Døggfallin' in the fall. The lyrics are in Faroese, but the mood is universal. The atmosphere is intimate, honest, profound, and emotional, inviting the listener into a personal connection - like a conversation between friends about challenging topics. The style falls within the realm of bedroom pop, mixed with a Nordic tone, wrapped in a bit of the mysterious Faroese fog. In April 2024, a remix version of the EP will be released, as well as a LP with both the original version and the remixes. On stage, she is accompanied by some of the finest musicians available in the Faroe Islands: Mattias Kapnas on piano and synth, Jan Rúni Poulsen on percussion and electronics, and Høgni Lisberg on guitar. The intimate and atmospheric ambiance will take center stage as Døgg Nónsgjógv performs her music at SPOT 2024.

name: Merry
description: Merry writes dark pop/sweet rock songs. With her captivating performance, she seeks to explore all the subtle sparks that arise between you and me. Merry's songs have emerged during a period in her life when everything felt like a clammy cloth against the cheek. They are about reclaiming ownership of one's own body, the joy and happiness in being oneself. Completely alone. Her lyrics deal with love and death, self-love, crushing on boys a little, and accepting when boys don't crush on you. Merry will release her debut single in August 2024.

name: Rommy Gabay
description:
Step into Rommy Gabay's world, where the soulful melodies act as her compass on a journey of self-discovery. Through her emotive voice, she shares stories that resonate with the heart, encouraging reflection and connection. Rommy's music inspires embracing authenticity and finding meaning in everyday moments. 

Drawing inspiration from a blend of pop, hip hop, and soul, Rommy, along with her band, crafts a dynamic sound that captivates audiences. Focused on crafting her upcoming EP, Rommy Gabay is setting sail on a new chapter of musical exploration and growth.

name: Simako
description:
Powered by sisters Sigrid and Katinka Moth-Poulsen, Simako presents a musical universe where R&B and soul meet catchy synth beats. With their deeply lyrical compositions, they bring to life the joys, sorrows, and mysteries that come with the pulsating rhythm of youth in Copenhagen.

The songs' clear and calm vocals echo a relaxed summer, enhanced by rhythmic keys and a harmony as natural as breathing. The sound universe is spiced up with harmonic nuances and creative details with support from Laust Petersen on drums, Julius Stenberdt on guitar, and Robert Watt Boolsen on bass. The result is an irresistible summer vibe.

name: Rezwan Taha & Luna Ersahin
description:
Rezwan Taha and Luna Ersahin are a duo consisting of two powerful singers with Kurdish and Kurdish/Danish backgrounds, otherwise active in projects like Rest In Beats and Aysay.

The deep connection to their roots, soulful vocal harmonies, and beautiful melodies are tied together by two strong musical personalities who remind us that we are stronger together. The power of their voices is at the forefront as they surrender to each other and the audience in love, play, and pain.

name: Taralillah
description:
Through her love for music, Taralillah has created a colorful and explosive sound universe that challenges the boundaries typically found in the music industry. With her powerful and catchy songs, the project builds on the musical experiences Taralillah Jasmine Hjørdis Hessellund has had since she was 15 years old. Her musical journey culminated in 2022 when she released her debut album 'Magnetic Feels', which gives the listener an experience of a strong and solid artist who knows what she wants. Taralillah aims to become one of the strongest artists in the queer music scene and thus make a difference for other LGBTQ+ individuals.

Her sound universe is based on a symbiosis between the fragile and the expressive, which is reflected in sharp and well-produced productions inspired by genres such as Slut-pop, Electro/Dance, and Punk. The lyrics are honest and address topics such as sexuality, freedom, and love. However, she also possesses a rebelliousness, which is evident in her latest single 'Gym Slut', where she addresses the sexualization of bodies.

name: Århus Sinfonietta
description:
Århus Sinfonietta is a Danish beacon for experimental contemporary music. The ensemble strives to create unique hybrid concerts for a wide and diverse audience, exploring ways to reduce the distance between the audience and the often boundary-seeking and challenging music that constitutes the core repertoire of the sinfonietta.

Step into a redesigned concert hall where you can move freely in the darkness behind and around the illuminated musicians from Århus Sinfonietta, and explore the very special interaction of the individual instruments – yes, even conversations – in two contrasting, expressive contemporary works featured in the concert.

For this concert, the ensemble invites German singer/songwriter and actress Jenny Thiele on stage. In Thomas Agerfeldt Olesen's emotionally dramatic work ‘Trennungsbriefe’, which the ensemble premiered in 2022, divorce is communicated through written word, via the speech of wordless instruments, and through Danish telemarketing. This conflict-filled space is balanced with Lil Lacy's hopeful ‘The Conch and The Chrysanthemum’ from the dream work ‘You're Somehow Connected’, which was performed at Aarhus Festuge's gala opening in 2021.

name: Thea Dora
description:
Thea Dora's music is full of energy, mixing catchy melodies on glitchy beats with a vulnerable vocal that draws the listener into her dreamy universe.

Thea Dora invites you into a plastic universe with real trees and flowers that live and grow. A magical place built around her strong attitude and striking vulnerability. With a penchant for seriously catchy pop hooks, she invites you to both dance and cry on a self-empowering wave towards embracing the confusion in life.

With only two singles out, 'Collected' and 'Harder', Thea Dora has cemented herself as an exciting new artist from Denmark, with clear international potential. Soundvenue included her in their Breaking Sound 2024 and called her one of the most exciting things happening in Denmark right now. Don’t miss her at SPOT Festival this spring.

name: Bette
description:
With the release of the single 'Bedre' on February 2nd, Bette solidifies one of the current trends: placing oneself as the protagonist in one's own life, even if another person occupies thoughts and emotions. 'Bedre' also marks the beginning of a new release phase for Bette, with new collaborators inside and outside the studio, and new music at the forefront of her agenda for 2024. 'Bedre' takes us into the peculiar time after a breakup, where one tries to convince oneself that everything will be okay again. Perhaps even better. But also how the self-imposed confidence that arises can, at times, make one doubt what the truth really is. Am I better now, or am I just pretending?

In addition to her regular musical collaborator, Johannes Wamberg, she has since invited songwriter August Fogh (GUZO) and the producer duo T&O into Bette-land. This new mix of people opens up a more outgoing sound, embracing the listener with strong hooks while maintaining Bette's knack for intuitive play with words and melodies. In true Bette style, the production is carried by curious R&B textures that support a lyrical universe unhesitatingly setting the agenda for Bette's own life.

name: Stephanie Meincke
description:
Stephanie Meincke makes music for the over-thinker. It’s hand played pop music that embraces everything from jealousy between friends to being afraid of the dark. Most importantly it’s an artistic antidote that forces all of us over-thinkers out of our heads and back to reality. Stephanie Meincke made her mark as a part of the Danish music scene, when she via an Instagram-post was handpicked to join Patrick Dorgan on his latest tour. Since then she has been touring with and playing support for artists such as Mina Okabe, Marie Fjeldsted, Aufori and Marc Facchini.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: Østerlide
description:
Østerlide swept onto the Norwegian folk music scene in late 2020, and quickly received international acclaim for their eponymous debut album. Their unusual arrangements of the traditional folk melodies give new perspectives and display a wide range of moods and textures - from a mere whisper to the brutally noisy.

Through open musical landscapes, or cramped and claustrophobic musical spaces, the listener is always carried on by the tireless and timeless folk melodies that have been shaped and honed through the centuries.

This concert is supported by Nordisk Kulturråd.

name: Betty Bass
description: With over 2 million streams on Spotify and a presence on the official Airplay Top-20 list, singer Betty Bass appears to be a success. And it's certainly not by chance. With her unparalleled technique, warm airy tone, laid-back rhythm, and international sound, she positions herself at the forefront of the Danish soul scene. When Betty Bass takes the stage at SPOT 2024, the audience can expect a tremendous experience and a setlist featuring many new songs.

name: Ari Árelíus
description:
For Reykjavík-based artist Ari Árelíus, the act of making music is not unlike composing a painting: an intuitive yet delicate merging of distinct elements to create moments of lasting transcendence. 

On his debut album ‘Hiatus Terræ’ (2022) he cross-pollinates elements of Icelandic music with sounds sourced from musical traditions from around the world. In recent years, the songwriter/guitarist/producer has explored such disparate genres as Saharan desert blues and psychedelic surf rock but this time the aim is set for indie folk with a dash of country twang.

After earning his degree in philosophy from the University of Iceland—an endeavor he considers an essential influence on his lyrical approach — Ari later studied guitar at a jazz conservatory in Iceland. A genre that is now a subconscious part of his musicality. 

Ari is releasing a new album in the summer of 2024 titled ‘Frank Poison and the Manufactured Feelings’.

name: Hvalfugl
description: Trembling musical presence, ambient sounds, and strong melodies come together in perfect harmony when the trio Hvalfugl takes the stage. Jonathan Fjord Bredholt's elegant piano figures and atmospheric soundscapes played on the harmonium intertwine with Jeppe Lavsen's crystalline guitar themes and Anders Juel Bomholt rocking contrabass in a way that creates both unity and rich detail, resulting in a rarely engaging live experience. With their gripping instrumental expression, the Aarhus-based trio has captivated both audiences and critics since the release of their debut album 'By' in 2017, which received acclaim both domestically and internationally. In the fall of 2023, Hvalfugl released the EP 'Strømmer.'

name: LuckyPause
description:
Following an impressive kickoff with just two performances at Smukfest and UHØRT Festival, the synthpop duo LuckyPause is already well on their way to taking over the starry sky with their unique sound and explosive energy.

LuckyPause consists of singer and musician Lærke Corfix and producer and musician Paw Eriksen, who in a short amount of time have established themselves as a new and exciting name that audiences can't get enough of. Their soundscape began to take form on a European highway when a spontaneous track was created on an old Mac computer, and vocals were recorded through a headset on the way to a supporting gig for 10,000 people in Luxembourg.

This spring marks the duo’s first release, accompanied by a promise to transform this summer’s festival stages into explosive experiences seasoned with heavy rhythms and an energy that practically explodes on stage. LuckyPause strives to create a synergistic experience with their audience, where the party is not just delivered but shared.

name: pære banal
description: pære banal is playful, minimalist post-punk that catches the ear off guard. With tight coordination and (un)pretentious Danish lyrics about being young and privileged in a chaotic world, pære banal never rests in the same place for many seconds, before moving on to the next riff, break, or tempo change. With their uniformed live concerts and an album in the bag, pære banal repeatedly manages to kick substantial ass and leave their listeners in a confused euphoria.

name: Søn
description:
In 2022, Søn released the singles ‘Ka Ik Connect’ and ‘HD Sol’, landing directly in A-rotation on P6 Beat and Best of the Year lists in Berlingske and Soundvenue. The band has just released their third studio album ‘Solstorm’, which, according to Information, “shines bright in the Danish music sky” and makes Søn “a band that deserves an even wider audience” (Politiken).

‘Solstorm’ is a 2023 love story where heartbreak exists alongside the climate crisis and anxiety about the future, while we are hit by raucous rock, dusty indie-pop, hand-played drill, and choir music.

Since the Copenhagen-based band’s debut album ‘Det Skandinaviske Design’ (2019), they have demonstrated with their overwhelming live shows that Søn is in a league of its own. On stage, Søn is versatile, exuberant, and known to blow the audience away. With unwavering presence, the band manages to combine the intimate and vulnerable with the intense and rock-like, leaving the audience in a place where they are simultaneously taken by the hand and made completely unaware of what’s about to happen.

name: VAKUUM
description: VAKUUM is a band that plays alternative pop/rock with hints of funk. With its eight members, VAKUUM creates a large sound with many dimensions—a sound that helped them secure victory at the DMF Reactor competition in spring 2022. In winter 2023, the band participated in SPOT På Midten, where they recorded a live session at Walthers Musikcafé in Skanderborg, which can be heard on YouTube. It is also in connection with SPOT På Midten that VAKUUM can be experienced at SPOT 2024.

name: Misty Coast
description:
Misty Coast is the dream pop child of Linn Frøkedal and Richard Myklebust, known from the Norwegian noise rock act The Megaphonic Thrift. They are known for their strong guitar hooks, distinctive bass lines and catchy, dreamy vocal melodies, and parallels can be drawn to bands such as Cocteau Twins, Mazzy Star and Broadcast. After ten years on the road with amplifiers turned to 11, tours supporting indie heroes like Dinosaur Jrand Steven Malkmus, a Norwegian Grammy (Spellemannprisen) sitting on the shelf, mild tinnitus and odd jobs back home to add on the rock’n’roll salary, Frøkedal and Myklebust decided to adjust the recipe and cook up a new witch’s brew.

Since Misty Coast’s debut album in 2017, the band has been on tour in Japan, the UK and Europe, played a number of club concerts and festivals in Norway, been nominated for the Norwegian Grammy and garnered rave reviews at home and abroad. In 2021 Misty Coast released their third album ‘When I Fall from the Sky’, produced by Emil Nikolaisen (Serena-Maneesh). They are now ready to show the world some new music, and have yet again teamed up with producer Matias Tellez (Young Dreams, girl in red). The singles ‘The End of the Beginning’, ‘Brainchild’ and ‘The Crossing’ were released in 2022, while the duo's newest album ‘Nevereverending’ was released October 2023.

name: Ki!
description:
Songwriter and multi-instrumentalist Christian Ki Dall released his debut album ‘The Boy From Haeundae Beach’ in 2022. With no less than 20 tracks, Ki! moves between various genres and inspirations in a mixtape equivalent to a travelogue. Like the audio version of notes scratched on the back of weathered photographs, pencil drawings, and pressed flowers collected in a banged-up notebook. 

There is undoubtedly something for everyone's taste.

From groovy Vietnamese-inspired Vong Co-style on ‘Mây Trôi’ to Motown magic on ‘Happy’ and old-school funk and soul with a loving nod to Warren G on ‘Karma Flow (feat Al Agami)’.

Ki! was born in South Korea and lived in an orphanage in the Haeundae district of Busan. He was adopted and grew up in Denmark. Ki!'s sound - the details and nuances that make Ki! Ki! - unfolds along the way. There is a holistic aspect to his eclecticism that gives the album both breadth and depth. And it must be experienced live.

name: Gustav Bjerrum
description:
Gustav Bjerrum creates Danish-language pop music that captures the sound of youth and that moment when the night seems endless. In the spring of 2024, he is currently releasing his first work, 'Wait Until Tomorrow.' Through a naive lyrical universe, the ruthless love is depicted through young eyes. Gustav's catchy melodies are propelled by potent grooves, incorporating a playful approach to music, creating a modern pop sound with threads of soul music - like a jam session between Bruno Mars, Charlie Puth, and Stevie Wonder. The music is delivered with great energy, an 'on top of the world' attitude, and a twinkle in the eye, ensuring a lively atmosphere when Gustav and his band take the stage.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: Karambolage
description:
Karambolage typically refers to a clash or conflict, but also has meanings such as close contact and rapprochement. The instrumental trio from Aarhus, Denmark, brings together bold noise-jazz, riffed dessert doom and proggy post-rock, creating movements between fragile, epic and intrusive moments in a raw cut expression.

The band's latest album is ‘Prås’ (2023), which critics describe as a cinematic experience that redefines the boundaries of instrumental rock.

name: Valgtemig
description: Valgtemig writes songs about existing in a chaos of feelings and the frustrations about a damned future with dead-end jobs and a world which is becoming increasingly more uncertain to live in. With a twinkle in the eye and great musical confidence, he challenges the common conventions of the hip hop genre with a fusion of jazz, soul and danish poetry.

name: KRIS
description: Kris creates music that you'd play on the train ride home after a disappointing night out, hoping the battery on your headphones lasts long enough to get you to your final destination. He isn't afraid to give thoughts and tunes to the backside of youth, choosing to confront and embrace his feelings rather than run from them. Each song is a snippet of everything rumbling inside Kris – and in many other young people. Desperation and release merge over playful beats as Kris projects his thoughts into the world with an intriguing and original vocal style. Kris is a performer by heart, and it shows the moment he steps onto the stage. In June, Kris became one of the two winners of KarriereKanonen 2023, impressing with the song 'Hvor blev hun af??'. Here, the singer draws from various branches of his vast talent, emphasizing that significant musical achievements lie ahead.

name: Rakkerpak
description: Rakkerpak brings with them a unique fusion of pop and hip-hop, brimming with energy and North Jutlandic charm. With six talented members, they masterfully balance between the lively youth life and deeper themes, all with an unparalleled dynamic on the stage. The unique sound and refined lyrics stem from the members' diverse backgrounds. Their shared love for hip-hop creates a creative space where experiments with rock, pop, and lengthy guitar solos constantly reinvent the good melody without losing the core of the music. Upon first time listening, it is clear that Rakkerpak strives to deliver a cohesive experience of energetic music, filled with catchy hooks and instrumental gems, resting on a solid foundation of bass and drums. Rakkerpak released their debut EP 'Manioekspressiv' in March 2023, which included songs such as 'Lad vær’ at tale til mig' (Don’t Talk To me) and 'Hovedet fyldt, tomme lommer', (Filled Head, Empty Pockets) and they will be ready with their second EP in the summer of 2024.

name: Hjalte Ross
description:
In the autumn of 2023, Hjalte Ross released his latest album 'Less'. He describes it as his most direct, vulnerable, and expressive songwriting ever, a process that has been more personal and meaningful than ever before. Self-produced, minimalistic, beautiful, and deadly is what the new Hjalte Ross album portends.

Already with the two albums, the debut 'Embody' (2018) and the follow-up 'Waves of Haste' (2020), the award-winning young artist established his name both in Denmark and on the international songwriting scene. The records were followed up by critically acclaimed concerts and great attention. KEXP, MOJO, Uncut, Clash Magazine, are just some of those who showed their love for the Danish songwriter.

Live, you will be able to experience what makes Ross and his fellow musicians very special talents. Every concert they let the songs live in the moment and perform them newly interpreted, freely, and vividly. Whether Hjalte Ross performs his songs solo, with a band, a string ensemble, or everything in between, it is with a real present sensitivity that is sure to move the audience. Whether it's a fragile acapella or a noisy guitar, Hjalte manages to keep a firm grip on the intensity. Hjalte Ross is a Danish songwriting talent of world-class caliber.

name: Astrid Engberg
description:
The Copenhagen based singer, producer, composer, and DJ Astrid Engberg, released her second album 'Trust' in September 2023. Astrid Engberg's music spans modern soul, R&B, nu jazz, and modern classical music, inviting the listener into a world of both minimalist and heavy productions, personal stories, and spiritual exploration. Her enchanting voice expresses both genuine sensitivity and profound strength.

In the fall of 2024, she will take the critically acclaimed album (featured in Politiken, GAFFA, Information, and more) on tour to Danish venues. Her debut album 'Tulpa,' listed by Bandcamp Daily as one of the best albums in 2020, also garnered national recognition when she won "Årets Bedste Vokaludgivelse" (Vocal Release of the Year) at the Danish Music Awards Jazz and the Steppeulven for "Årets Producer" (Producer of the Year).

On her debut album 'Tulpa,' Astrid expressed her mental and physical recovery after a head injury that still affects her daily life over a decade later. On 'Trust,' Astrid celebrates intuition and motherhood with all its facets. She collaborates with various Nordic talents such as Maria Dybbroe, Tobias Wiklund, and J. Ludvig III, as well as Los Angeles-based Miguel Atwood-Ferguson, an esteemed multi-instrumentalist, conductor, and composer. The album took shape after the birth of her first child and was created with playful joy, openness, and gratitude over a period of nine months.

name: ASTA NORR
description: 22-year-old ASTA NORR has a voice and musicality that are not seen every day. For the singer, genres and boundaries are meant to be broken, and she effortlessly blends her background in classical music and jazz with a love for pop, hip-hop, and reggaeton. The musician sprinkles her melodious vocals over the Latin-inspired singles, 'Wifey' and 'Endgame Baby', which recently hit streaming services and resonated on the radio.

name: Prototypen
description:
Prototypen is a brand new artist from Aarhus. He sings about the absurd and beautiful in the banalities of life. When you listen to Prototypen’s songs, you are initially hit by joy and laughter, but the more you listen, contemplation creeps in.

With his observing and honest approach to the world, Prototypen never attempts to be something other than what he is. He sings of our modern life, but at the same time he has roots in an old Danish music culture, bringing to mind artists like C.V. Jørgensen, Povl Dissing, Røde Mor and Troels Trier.

name: IVAN$ITO
description:
Self-made and eclectic to the core, IVAN$ITO crushes any box you might want to put him in. Born to Chilean immigrants in Denmark, Iván Lemus Barrales Spargo Martínez has traveled across fluid musical and cultural borders for his entire life. 

As a preteen, his uncle introduced him to Boyz II Men; on visits to Chile, his cousins put him on to Daddy Yankee and Don Omar. He’d often spend a whole day watching performance videos of iconic bands like Earth, Wind & Fire with his father, mesmerized by the allure of the entertainment world. Enraptured by these diverse influences, he knew that his future lay in music, and while traveling back and forth between Denmark, LA and Chile IVAN$ITO has developed his music. 

His new album ‘CONFUNDIDO’ was released in March and it’s his most impressive and versatile project to date. Its stories of infatuation and estrangement showcase IVAN$ITO’s capacious vision of Spanish-language music: ‘CONFUNDIDO’ luxuriates in a broad spectrum of sounds, dipping into elements of R&B, trap, reggaeton, flamenco, ballads, and beyond.

name: Morice
description:
Morice, a young rapper from Aarhus, released his debut EP ‘KVALME’ in the summer of 2023. He embraces the personal and vulnerable with honest stories and reflections on human insecurities and ruminations. 

Safely, he takes the audience by the hand and guides the listener through a musical journey where there is room to be oneself, for better or worse, with minimalist jazzy and electronic productions ranging from sweet and dreamy songs to the raw and unusual.

Live, Morice shows up with a full band that further breathes life, feeling, and dynamics into the songs, creating a present experience.

name: Synne Sanden
description: Synne Sanden is a Norwegian, experimental pop artist with 5 solo albums and two EPs behind her. The artist is inspired by Björk and Thom Yorke, but most of all her emotional spectrum. She has toured in Italy, Canada and Norway and has collaborated with big Norwegian names such as Thomas Dybdahl and Bugge Wesseltoft. At SPOT she brings her unique band and visual world to impress the audience.

name: Sofie1998
description: Sofie1998 writes and produces songs which serve as open diaries filled with warmth, enjoyment of life, and self-irony. She portrays the ironic absurdities and challenges of everyday life with a twinkle in her eye and a smile on her lips. Sofie is not afraid to laugh at herself. In her songs, she combines what many would describe as solid pop songwriting with tones from American R’n’B, forming the soundtrack to her life. In 2020, Sofie moved from Jutland to Copenhagen in her pursuit of a music career. She participated in the KarriereKanonens program in 2022, and her placement in KarriereKanonen final acted as a catalyst for refining her musical expression and craftsmanship in recent years. Sofie1998 is now releasing new music, and she has dropped the first single from her debut EP 'Norwegian Airlines,' set to be released in March.

name: Aya Vedige
description:
Aya Vedige is a bundle of emotions in a small body. Her lyrics tell tales of everyday contradictions, such as the fear of losing others, but also the desire to walk alone. Aya Vedige is Danish electronic pop that dares to grab the listener with straightforward anecdotes about not always having it all together but understanding that everything is a process. Her songs are guaranteed to kickstart conversations about taboo topics in everyday life after a concert.

On stage, Aya Vedige is hard to ignore, as she shapes musical scenarios with a wealth of emotions and real-life sounds. The listener is invited on an awkward 'solo' trip to Street Food, to a club with a hunger for skin, and on a road trip with an ex-boyfriend afraid of the new tick-borne disease. In the spring of '22, she debuted with her first EP on a small tour in Jutland, including performances at Aarhus Musikhus, the grand Århundredets Festival, Skråen in Aalborg, UnderSpot, and 1000fryd. The EP was recommended by KarriereKanonen, played in London, Berlin, Colombia, and featured in publications such as Ud&Se, Aarhus Stiftstidende, and an interview with Uniradioen. Since then, she has performed numerous concerts in both Copenhagen and Jutland.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: Poptones
description:
Poptones represent a world of shattered expectations and unpredictability. With a sound that blends avant-garde and experimental rock with hardcore and indie influences, the music can change direction at any moment. And that's precisely what drives the Copenhagen-based trio: the desire to challenge and surprise.

During their liveperformance, the band explores the intersection of noise and harmonies, creating a powerful concert experience. In 2022, Poptones released the album 'Between Darkness & Daylight' and has a new album in the works. The first single will be released this spring.

name: Snuggle
description:
Baby in Vain singer and songwriter Andrea Thuesen and former Liss producer Vilhelm Strange join worlds to create snuggle. Both guitar players by heart, snuggles sounds are abundant with riffs and ethereal vibes. Their sonic symbiosis weave guitars and breathy vocal harmonies into a fuzzy blanket evoking wall-of-sound grunge and shoe-gaze melting with eclectic drum productions.

While they have been writing and playing music from before they could speak, with many records under their belt, the new constellation snuggle has only existed for a little over a year. In the fall of 2023 they released their debut EP ‘Calendula’. The EP’s title is a tribute to Vilhelm Strange’s late friend whose favorite flower was the Calendula.

In snuggle the duo set out to change their ways but still love where they come from - listen and get carried aw

name: Tamara
description: The talented R&B artist Tamara released her debut EP, 'Perks of A Wild Heart,' in October 2023, exploring the deep emotions and thoughts that define her as an artist. Tamara's songs are a musical exploration of freedom, vulnerability, and personal growth, creating an intimate emotional space for the listener to immerse themselves in. Tamara's first singles, 'Solo Crowd' and 'I Should Have Known Better,' were both well-received, with airplay on P3 and placement on playlists on various streaming services, such as NMF in Denmark, Norway, and Iceland, as well as on Spotify.

name: AGGi
description:
In a mix between afro rhythms and a modern, european approach to hiphop, AGGi fusions the best from Ghana and Denmark. She draws on a broad spectrum of inspiration and mixes catchy melodies with refreshing, ‘bouncy’ rap, matching the well-produced beats perfectly.

At this point, AGGi has placed her musical footprints on the danish underground scene, but after meeting the talented producer and artist Anguyo, she has been working on a new sound, which was received favorably in the summer of 2023 with the first single ‘Better Money’ followed by the single ‘Waste No Time’.

With previous releases, AGGi has been heard on BBC Radio 6 and played festivals like SPOT and GrimFest, and venues like VEGA and Train.

name: Dusin
description:
Dusin has undergone a creative quantum leap and is set to release a new full-length album in 2024. The album reflects the fact that Jesper Nohrstedt Boesgaard is one of the country's greatest songwriting talents and vocalists, with the single 'Når Det Brænder' being the first release from it. The song is a well-crafted pop anthem with a grandiose and 80s-inspired chorus that, once heard, lingers throughout the day.

After releasing a mini-album in the summer of 2022, Jesper chose to step back from Dusin and focus even more on his career as a songwriter. This decision resulted in several top-50 tracks and gold and platinum certifications ('All In' – Blæst x Lamin, 'Stiv Kuling' (EP) – Blæst, and others), elevating his songwriting to a new level. Slowly, the urge to create music under his own project, Dusin, returned, leading to late-night sessions in his home studio on Øster Voldgade. Accompanied by Mads Vadsager, the creation of an album began, proving to be the most ambitious and cohesive to date.

name: Kaizer
description:
Over the past two years, there has been a buzz around the emerging indie talent Kaizer on the live front. In 2022, Kaizer won TAK ROCK's live competition and performed at Smukfest's LiveCamp. In 2023 she followed up with a support tour for Dopha, and last year she made her debut at SPOT Festival—recognized by Soundvenue as one of the 10 highlights from Saturday's program. In March of this year, Kaizer also made her headlining debut to a packed VEGA in Copenhagen, so she is ready to take on SPOT once again. Kaizer is particularly characterized by blending Scandinavian pop tradition with audacity and grunge energy, as seen on her latest dance hit "Kurt Cobain"—perhaps you've already heard it on the radio?

In live performances, Kaizer is a collaborative project, further complemented by bassist Magnus Ram Pedersen, drummer Lasse Herold Krarup, and guitarist Daniel Larsen.

name: Gugusar
description:
It is close to impossible to put gugusar’s music in one box or certain genre. Her music ranges from being soft and melodic, to heavy drum & bass. Gugusar is also not afraid to jump between writing in Icelandic and English, and sometimes she just hums and sings in no language. Her music is experimental and there is no telling what is around the corner when you listen to her music. 

Icelandic Gugusar produces and writes all her songs on her own. She released her debut album ‘Listen To This Twice’ when she was only 15 years old, and her second album was released in 2021. Both albums were nominated in the category ‘Album Of The Year’ at the Icelandic Music Awards. Gugusar began performing at a very young age as a figure skater. There, she fell in love with performing and being on stage, in front of crowds. Her love for performing on ice was transcended by performing her own music on stage. It is obvious in her musical performances that she was once a figure skater when she dances on stage. Gugusar sometimes choreographs dance routines and uses them to elevate her performance.

name: Pak
description: Pak has impressed with their unwavering and youthful energy, along with an originality in their sound that manages to look back to idols like Gasolin and Oasis while being refreshing and modern. Back in the summer of 2023, the rock band kicked off their career with their debut single 'Herfra' – a single that P6 Beat quickly added to their regular rotation, followed by the single 'Spidermand.' The quartet has already played a good number of concerts, and the noticeable chemistry among the band members is evident on stage, where lead singer Loui Henderson's undeniable talent for charming the audience is on full display.

name: Vepsestikk
description: Vepsestikk is an indie band from Bergen, Norway that experiments with various elements from punk, prog rock and jazz. With groovy rhythms, melodious bass, dreamy guitar and trumpet in stereo, Vepsestikk form an exciting witch's brew, which makes you "move on the dance floor in a sober state" (Krøvel, Universitas). The vocals alternate between desperate battlecries from the stomach and vulnerable siren song from the heart. The quartet have received attention in the Norwegian music scene, and have played festivals like Bergenfest, Vossajazz, Havstrømfestivalen in Oslo and UKA in Trondheim. Recently, they have also captured the Swedish audience at the indie club Heaven up Here in Stockholm.

name: Justine Boesen
description:
Justine Boesen fra Danmark skaber med sit akkordeon og sin klare sopranvokal et unikt og sensitivt univers. Med sit usædvanlige instrument inviterer hun med et dramaturgisk nærvær lytteren ind i et moderne lyrisk sangunivers, hvor hun med effekter, loops og digte skaber en helstøbt performance. Med en kærlighed til den nordiske musik og klang, samt en fascination af tidens stærke sopransangerinder, såsom Eivør og Kate Bush, går Justine Boesen på scenen med et fortællende nærvær, hvor hendes originale digte og tekster står forrest, når hun svøber dem i sin symbiotiske lyd af akkordeon og vokal.

Justine Boesen modtog i 2024 prisen som "Årets Katapult" og var i 2023 nomineret til en DMA som "Årets Nye Danske Rootsnavn". Justine Boesen var desuden hovednavn på den anerkendte tyske festival Folkbaltica i 2023, hvor hun i samme periode udgav sine tre første debut-singler i eget navn.

name: Dør I Dine Arme
description:
Dør i Dine Arme is a new Danish-language electronic pop duo. Their music speaks directly to the issues and concerns of today's youth, pushing the boundaries of what is considered mainstream. The duo emerged in the early months of 2023, driven by a desire for contemporary Danish-language music that could both fit into the pop world and be more experimental, challenging, and alternative in terms of sound design and composition. The lyrical universe of Dør i Dine Arme reflects an imperfect world, taking the listener into a perhaps more unconventional realm not often encountered in mainstream music, with a focus on existentialism and breaking norms.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: Left Up Right
description:
Left Up Right is a young band that, with an energetic and open approach, explores the boundaries between musical worlds. 

The name - Left Up Right - reflects the band's approach to music: They move in different directions, challenge conventions, and create something new. From the left, the freedom of jazz, upward electronic rhythms, and to the right, toward the endless diversity of world music. 

Follow along on a musical journey as Left Up Right opens the door to their dynamic and modern universe of sound.

name: The Concrete Boys
description: The Concrete Boys are a rare breed of sick birds who combine catchy melodies with confrontational badassery. A trio that pours scorching hot music into your festering wounds. It's hard and loud. And deconstructive. It's freedom, corruption, and desire. It's the band you love to hate. It's punk in its physical form. You might as well surrender.

name: White Dwarf – Maya Westman Memorial Concert
description:
In 2019, singer and songwriter Maya Westman left this world after a prolonged battle with cancer, at the young age of just 34. Prior to her departure, she managed to record the sessions for the album 'White Dwarf,' which was subsequently completed following the instructions she had left behind. The album was posthumously released in October 2023. It is a creation of an uncompromising artist who, through her whimsical lyrical universe and detailed compositions, presents stories of being a stubborn wingman, a darkly humorous nostalgic trip to a bygone era, strong portrayals of women, and, notably, her journey through illness. A beautiful and deeply personal album, with grand gestures that pay homage to icons like Bowie and Lennox.

A group of prominent singers, who’s also close friends, and colleagues of Maya Westman have come together to bring her songs to life on the live stage, an opportunity she did not have herself. With a solid band comprised of musicians from Westman's band, they will interpret the songs from 'White Dwarf' into a unique concert experience during SPOT 2024.

The soloists include Nanna Schannong (Lowly), Stine Grøn (IRAH), Bess Barkholt (BESS), Terkel Atsushi Røjle (Atusji), Mathias Bertelsen (The Entrepreneurs), Tania Ballentine (LadyJerk), Lo Ersare (Lucky Lo), Greta Schenk (GRETA), Kaspar Vig, and Camilla Munck.

The band consists of Greta Schenk (GRETA), Gertrud Hjelm Kongshøj, Ida Urd Bramming (Lucky Lo, Swan Lee, among others), Jonas Wetterslev (The Entrepreneurs, among others), Rasmus Oppenhagen Krogh (Takykardia, Guldimund, among others).

name: Dahlin
description: In 2023, Dahlin won KarriereKanonen, after which she released her debut single 'Boycut', which ended up as P3's "Ugens Uundgåelige" and has garnered over 500 plays on the channel. Since then, Dahlin has played her first sold-out concert at Vega despite having released only one song at that time. But there is more to come, as Dahlin has just released her second single 'Intercitylyn'.

name: Brimheim
description:
She is one of the most prominent shooting stars on the alternative pop and rock scene - in Denmark and internationally. Under the artist name Brimheim - which in Faroese means "home of the breaking waves" - Danish/Faroese Helena Rebensdorff has quickly established herself as an inevitable and influential black diamond.

Forever boundary-pushing and impossible to pigeonhole. That's how Brimheim explores and exposes the most intimate corners and unforgiving depths of the mind. The vulnerable and heart-wrenching, the brutal and grandiose.

Since the EP ‘Myself Misspelled (2020) and especially the debut album ‘Can't Hate Myself Into A Different Shape’ (2022), Brimheim has garnered a sea of ??acclaim among critics both at home and internationally. Most recently, the single ‘Brand New Woman’ (feat. eee gee) has only proven Brimheim's simultaneously grand, international, and captivating sound even more.

name: Clothing Club
description:
Forget about melancholy, despondency and loneliness. Clothing Club makes you bob your head, smile and be present in the moment. It's vibrant hip-hop/jazz with a splash of house, which merges Aarhus jazz with the dance floor of the club in Berlin.

When the three musicians take the stage, the audience is invited into a present and playful space, which oozes with the joy of playing and a good mood. Keys, bass, drums - that's all it takes to create your next favorite lo/fi club party - and you're always invited!

name: Sauna Senere
description:
Expect an uplifting sonic experience when encountering Sauna Senere, an experimental punkish corporate collective from Aarhus. Their up-tempo songs exude infectious energy and transport you through a sonic landscape resonating with childlike honesty. Drawing inspiration from punk, pop, rave music, and more, Sauna Senere creates a unique and ever-changing sound experience.

In 2023, the band played a wide range of concerts, and showcased their products at events such as SPOT, Grimfest, Smukfest, following up with an extensive tour across the country, and most recently at Train and VEGA, to present their business plans at VEGAs Udvalgte 2024.

name: Nana Rashid
description:
Nana Rashid is a Danish jazz artist with roots in Oman and Zanzibar. The essence of everything Nana does is a belief that music can reveal all that is human. The listener is met with honesty and openness, bringing forth the invisible but palpable bonds that connect people. It is simultaneously intense and soothing.

With a fresh take on classic jazz techniques, Nana delves into contemporary dilemmas. Her songs are filled with the melancholy and contemplation of the nighttime hours. Themes of belonging and finding one's own identity, navigating the challenges of love, being a woman, and all the expectations that come with it are explored. Critics have described Nana as proof that there are still significant and undiscovered talents in jazz. She is a singer with an amazing voice and an approach to music that is both naked, vulnerable, and strong. Her depth of emotion and immediate musicality has been compared to greats like Nina Simone. Nana Rashid's debut album, 'Music For Betty,' was released in 2023.

name: Alexander Oscar
description: As a child, Alexander Oscar dreamt of telling stories that would resonate with other people. After a long journey, full of introspection and silence, he is ready to come back. With roots stretching far, and voices waiting to be heard, his next page is ready to be turned. This chapter of Alexander Oscar’s carriere will be a mix of old and new, personal and universal.

name: Jasser
description:
Jasser delivers music that makes you want to grab a hairbrush and sing in front of your mirror. In a sound universe built on the nerve of 00's pop/rock and the emotions of today's pop, Jasser provides an honest glimpse into the everyday life of a young person with all its ups and downs.

With enchanting naivety, Jasser is ready to seduce you like an old teenage crush. Through her lyrics, she explores the mentality of young people, drawing inspiration from her own observations and experiences, in an attempt to be a reflection of the youthful mind. Using dreamy guitars and synths, hard-hitting drums, and a magnificent vocal, Jasser will take the listener by the hand through inner conflicts, overthinking, and other relatable issues.

Whether you're in a party mood, heartbroken, or just need to eat ice cream in bed and watch movies, Jasser is ready to be the singer who guides you through it all.

name: Magnus Münster
description:
With his clean and modern sound, Magnus Münster offers a flourishing and sensitive interpretation of how pop music in 2024, drawing inspiration from the '70s, should sound. The talented 21-year-old artist draws inspiration from a variety of prominent musicians such as Paul McCartney and Paolo Nutini, as well as contemporary pop stars like Harry Styles and The 1975. The result: he manages to touch a broad spectrum of emotions with his clean and modern, high-quality pop.

The young singer-songwriter from Hørsholm captivated Denmark with his debut single 'So Last Year' and has just released his latest single 'Something I Don’t Already Know.' With his honest lyrics, Magnus Münster takes the audience through the entire emotional spectrum, accompanied by big smiles and humor in a captivating live experience.

name: Pleaser
description:
Pleaser is steam rolling noise and singalongable tunes.

They are a punk band but also a band that – by way of the differing backgrounds of the four members (including members from Konvent and Slægt) – has found their own unique mode of expression. It is both catchy and impenetrable with harmony, dissonance, riffs and rhythmic shifts jumbling together. Pleaser chews it all up and infuses it with their own noisy but charming melodic rattle.
