The songs contemplate themes of life and death, subconscious patterns, fear and desperation, but also growth, hope and love.

Their performance at Roskilde Festival last year got highlighted by critics and sparked airplay on BBC Radio 6. Pleaser’s critically acclaimed debut album was released in September last year.

name: MILEZ
description:
The only 20-year-old multinational rapper, MILEZ, is ready to take the stage in 2024 with an impressive array of singles that not only captivate listeners within Denmark's borders but also appeal to an international audience. His music takes listeners on a journey from the vibrant streets of Copenhagen to the gloomy housing estates of London and the sunny coastal towns of Italy, reflecting his diverse background and setting a new standard for English and Italian music in Denmark.

With an impressive repertoire of live shows, including opening for prominent names like Spanish Morad and the American hip hop legend R.A. the Rugged Man, MILEZ has already proven himself as a dynamic performer. His energetic performances combine youthful exuberance with deep reflection, and his ability to convey strong messages through sharp flows and mature delivery impresses audiences time and time again. In addition to his musical career, MILEZ has established commercial partnerships with renowned clothing brands such as IGLO & SABOCHINI in Copenhagen and has gained international recognition with releases on platforms such as LINK UP TV.

name: Ingrid Jasmin
description:
Ingrid Jasmin's electro-acoustic rhythms don't sound like anything you've heard before. Her music draws beautiful strings between the strong Norwegian tradition of folk music she grew up around, and the flamenco tradition, which she’s studied closely through her Spanish-speaking roots while living in both Cuba and Spain.

It's all delivered with a distinctive vocal and enveloped in modern productions. The result is enchanting. Like a Nordic Rosalía infused with the longing calls and string instruments that are so characteristic of Norwegian folk music.

Her debut single ‘Pilgrim’ from 2021 took the Norwegian music scene by storm, and her debut album ‘Luna,’ where she sings in both Norwegian and Spanish, earned her a Norwegian Grammy in 2022.

In 2024, she went all the way to the final in the Norwegian Melodi Grand Prix with the song ‘Eya’.

name: ORM
description: Musically, one is swept away by ORM's ever-changing and captivating universe, where mythical tales of humans and nature symbiotically merge with grand, melodic, and simultaneously raw and direct black metal. ORM's popularity on the Danish metal scene is undeniable, and their previous releases, the album 'Ir' (2019) and the EP 'Mit Blod' (2020), have been praised by critics from publications such as Politiken, Information, and GAFFA. In November 2023, ORM took the stage at DR's Koncertsal for a sold-out concert, creating a musical experience beyond the ordinary, and they brought with them their latest album 'Intet • Altet' (2022). A double album that once again expanded the boundaries of ORM's epic and forward-thinking black metal.

name: Rest In Beats
description:
Rest In Beats is an eternal love project. Both musically and spiritually. It is unique Danish/Kurdish life poetry and beautiful choir layers resting on top of organic and catchy beats. The duo consists of the two playful souls Rezwan Taha and Sebastian Thielke, known for their intense synergy on stage and for songs such as 'Fugle kan dø' and their latest EP 'Synge Igen'.

Kurdish Rezwan Taha and her voice possess a rare presence and sincerity, which, combined with her deeply personal lyrical universe, captivates the listener. Powerful soul singing blends pain, love, and hope, leaving a touched audience with a feeling of being embraced.

name: GiddyGang & Vuyo
description:
GiddyGang & Vuyo is not just a band - it's a collective heartbeat pulsating with hip-hop, soul, and jazz vibes, creating music from a place of joy and social consciousness. 

The group was formed in 2019 after meeting at the music college NLA Staffeldtsgate in Oslo. 

The sound is shaped by the members' diverse musical backgrounds, and the lyrics are inspired by personal experiences and the current status quo in society. On their sonic journey, they have received praise from a number of notable artists, including Robert Glasper, Mac Ayres, and Jazzy Jeff, just to name a few. After refining their craft through studio work and performances, GiddyGang & Vuyo are shifting gears, ready to bring a more artistic approach to their live performances.

name: ANKAH
description:
ANKAH seamlessly blends intricate harmonies with heartfelt lyrics and lush grooves, creating a sound reminiscent of 90's R&B with a hint of indie pop and neo-soul. In 2023, she released her EP, ‘Soaked’, which received airplay on P8 JAZZ and was featured in Soundvenue. Drawing inspiration from Danish literary icons such as Inger Christensen and Tove Ditlevsen, ANKAH challenges the idealized portrayals of love in pop culture, carving out space for alternative perspectives to thrive. She has received a Scandinavian Soul Music Award and composed music for the theater piece ‘DIX’, which earned "Best Performance" at Scenekunstens Priser, 2023. With her strong melodies and laid-back flow, ANKAH delivers a raw live performance that celebrates the vulnerable and unfiltered.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: Elias Rønnenfelt
description: Elias Rønnenfelt is a Danish musician, poet, lead singer and lyricist for the band Iceage. He is performing songs under his own name. Among the latest entries to Rønnenfelt’s discography is likely to be a solo album born out of the pandemic, which Rønnenfelt is currently putting the final touches on. Fed up with not being able to tour, Elias Rønnenfelt took matters into his own hands. “I was just sick of that and I was like, ‘How can I still do what I do?’ I did an Instagram thing and made a public email and said, ‘I’ll play anywhere. Just write me, I’ll play.’ I had a summer where I was traveling alone all over Europe and playing all sorts of unforeseen places. I realized that with these acoustic shows, on the road, I could write and play it the next day. So, a collection of songs formed. They were meant for being played acoustically, but I built them out from there" - Blunt Magazine

name: Rigmor
description:
Aarhus-based Rigmor provides melancholic indie rock in the sphere between the gentle and the clamorous. 

The band, which consists of Sarah Wichmann, Oliver Stewart, Victor Sousa and Lasse Lykke, released their debut album ‘Glade Blinde Børn’ (2022) to great acclaim from GAFFA and Weekendavisen among others. In March 2024 Rigmor released their newest album ‘Vælter Vi Mørket’, which will be brought to the stage this spring.

Abroad the band has received attention for their KEXP live session on the broadcasting channel’s YouTube-page. The live session currently has over 100.000 plays and has exposed Rigmors danish lyrics to the whole world, leading to interviews in Poland and Malaysia.  

On stage Rigmor has also distinguished themselves as one of the most impactful Danish live acts in recent years. Their performances are characterized by a strong sense of authenticity and great bursts of energy. Now, once again, you can look forward to an extraordinary live music experience when Rigmor visits SPOT, this time bringing some brand new tracks with them.

name: Yune
description:
Yune at SPOT 2024 will be one of the first times the public meets the band, since they vanished into Nis Bysted recording studio three years ago. The result will be released as the band's second album on Crunchy Frog in September 2024 and will present wildly manipulated, radical takes on what basically started as simple live versions of half-finished alt rock sketches. The first single ‘Cake’ was released in December 2023 and has already caught the attention of both listeners and reviewers.

Live you should expect a real band with plenty of love to share with both each other and the audience.

name: Jacob Bellens
description: Thanks to his unique voice and considerable songwriting talent, Jacob Bellens has become one of the most prominent figures on the Scandinavian music scene over the years. He has been releasing music since 2004, both as a solo artist, with the duo project Murder, and as the lead singer and songwriter for the band I Got You On Tape. Additionally, he has collaborated with various artists such as Kasper Bjørke and AV AV AV, and he also writes songs and lyrics for other musicians. Jacob Bellens has released numerous solo albums, and in 2023, another one titled 'Off My Meds' was released.

name: Karen Juhl
description: Karen Juhl, a Danish experimental star, blends influences from Laurie Anderson, Solange, and M.I.A. and crafts visionary art pop. Her debut masterpiece, "Mother Tongue," has garnered acclaim from BBC6, Metal Mag, and Groove Mag. Witness the fusion of club culture and chamber music in her live shows, where rhythmic fragments meld with MIDI harp improvisations, creating a mesmerizing performance.

name: Von Quar
description:
After establishing himself as the fiercest drummer at Viborg Stadium, he now steps into the spotlight and fulfills his own creative vision as Von Quar.

Von Quar writes Danish-language hooligan-rock music with a universe of hypnotic synths, hard-hitting drums, and loud vocals from the national sport. Von Quar pulls you into an electronic hooligan rave party, with a nod to punk and its rawness - while also immersing you in the hopeful atmosphere of catchy melodies and Bon Iver-inspired vocals.

name: ILMA
description:
Listening to ILMA's music feels like coming home, if you live on  Jupiter. Present in a celestial way and with a spectrum as vast as the North Sea where she grew up. She lets go where others hold on, floating freely through a sonic universe filled with crackling rhythms, flowing 808s, and ethereal synths. From the first listen, you are drawn into ILMA's unique world, where wingspans are broad, waves are high, and expenses are vast. In this broad landscape, the distinctive shapes are genuinely visible and certainly not obscure, allowing you to dive deep into her commanding voice. The music resonates internationally in its genre fusion of pop, hip-hop, R&B, and urban, evoking associations with names like 070 Shake, Don Toliver, and Kehlani.

With her Bosnian roots, born into a cultural intersection between Sarajevo and Thisted, ILMA found her way into music through Soundcloud, becoming part of an international community that quickly recognized her talent. Since then, she has been connected to music as a producer, performer, and songwriter, resulting in a strong and well-crafted expression. The cultural duality has given her insight and a range of experiences that contribute substance to her profound lyrical universe.

name: døssing
description:
The sibling ensemble døssing blends Nordic modern jazz with musical influences from lounge and dub.

In 2022 døssing released their debut album ‘All Inclusive’, which was a narrative-guided, auditory journey through a hotel-inspired universe. The album was Album of the Week on P8 Jazz with frequent rotation and received great reviews from GAFFA and Information among others.

Their sound is characterized by the meeting between the acoustic and the electronic, and it is clear that the group comes from a background where music and creative input have played a significant role. As children of the folktronica pioneers from Sorten Muld and with much of their childhood spent in the co-housing community Toustrup Mark in East Jutland, the members have been immersed in music, community, and co-creation from an early age.

døssing emerged after an interval where each of the siblings was occupied with other musical projects such as Abekejser, AySay, and Total Hip Replacement, but wanted to make music together.

In addition to siblings Mathilde Døssing Bendixen (Trombone/Vocals), Aske Døssing Bendixen (Drums), Jon Døssing Bendixen (Keys/Synthesizer), Annestine Døssing Bendixen (Trumpet/Speak), the group has expanded the family with the permanent member Thit Helbo Møller (Percussion).

Døssing will tour with new music throughout Denmark in September 2024.

name: Kundo
description: Kundo's music combines the traditional rap edge and heavy beats, which, along with a more pop and melodic side, creates a delicious overall picture and truly showcases what he stands for. The young and talented rapper from Vejle made his debut in early 2023 with the single '7100', which was well-received and added to P3's rotation the same week. In the summer, Kundo released his critically acclaimed debut EP 'Bar' En Drøm'. The EP truly demonstrated the young rapper's ability to create refreshing, innovative, and thoughtful music. Earlier this year, he released the single 'Northface', a collaboration with rapper Lamin, and the song has accumulated over 600,000 streams on Spotify.

name: Rambow
description: Rambow is a young multitalent with a prominent personality that shines through in all the projects he is involved in. Rambow, also known as Simon Negash, gained recognition in 2018 as an actor with the lead role in the NRK series 'Rektors kontor.' In 2020, he kickstarted his music career and released his very first single, 'Bentley.' Both as an actor and an artist, Rambow has already built a solid fan base at the age of 19. With only four singles released in 2020, Rambow was named 'Årets Urørt' (Rookie of the Year) by NRK P3 in 2021. That same year, he was seen performing at P3 Gull, and in 2023, he was nominated as ‘Breakthrough of the Year’ at P3 Gull. The artist name is inspired by the movie character Rambo, but it mainly reflects the rap style that Simon embodies when delivering rhymes like arrows from a bow.

name: Komorebi Garden
description: Komorebi Garden could be the name of a botanical garden in a far away galaxy. Maybe that’s why the term fits their futuristic R&B, which possesses an ethereal, almost otherworldly quality, so well. With a mix of syncopated beats, deep bass and fragile vocal harmonies, the young duo has created a completely unique sonic expression.

name: USERS
description: USERS is an emerging post-punk band that has quickly sent shockwaves through the Danish music scene. Rooted in socially critical activism, the fight for a new society is manifested through noisy riffs, aggressive vocals and thought-provoking lyrics. The music is a wake-up call you can dance to, and there will be plenty of opportunity to do so as USERS present hope among frustrations at a fast pace. Despite the band's short lifespan, they have unequivocally proven, through their uncompromising, explosive, and sharp live shows, that they fill a void in the music scene.

name: Yör
description:
Yör is the sound of dreamy, raw honesty, drawing the listener into their authentic and immersive indie-pop universe. Yör combines the delicate and intimate with the grand and explosive. A unique Danish-language lyrical universe unfolds in a dreamy combination of organic and electronic instruments. Lead singer Marie Kildebæk's captivating vocals and lyrical talent take center stage in a framework of raw synth textures, with a pulsating heart of deep bass and drums.

In the fall of 2023, Yör released their long-awaited and critically acclaimed debut album, 'intet så rigtigt,' which had been in the works for several years. The album has already made a significant impact on the Danish music landscape, showcasing Yör as one of the most interesting names in the Danish indie scene.

It's an album of sonically embracing Scandinavian indie-pop, featuring poetic and impressionistic songwriting seasoned with neon lights and magnificent synth landscapes that span a wide range, from indie-techno to intimate ballads. With sold-out headline concerts at venues like Lille VEGA, Empire Bio, Volume Village, and Villa Kultur, Yör has demonstrated their ability to create an intimate connection with their audience, leaving them enchanted and enriched. Yör's unique sound and musical prowess have secured them a place among the most promising talents in the Danish music scene.

name: MAGNUR
description:
Liberation. From oneself; from one's old, outdated self that holds one back from being who they truly are. An exorcism from yesterday's demons, delivered on a weathered platter of shame, fear, anger, and prayers for forgiveness, as well as justification. MAGNUR dares to be ugly, boundary-pushing, and ultimately invincible, for everything is given, and therefore everything is gained.

Electronic experiments in tactile sounds and harsh noise, both caressing and scraping the ear, underscore an expressive voice that dives into a thousand expressions, through silky-smooth or granite-hard paths of shouting, screaming, and soothing singing. Ambient, drum'n'bass, and dance, among other elements, join the journey. On stage, alone or with a band behind, MAGNUR is volcanic and raw physical expression. MAGNUR released the album 'Nyde Lyde' in 2022, a dark-ambient work delving into human darkness, one's own doomsday, and life after time. Based in Aarhus, MAGNUR is currently working on the EP 'DI,' expected to be released in the spring of 2024, featuring the single 'Hey Daddy.'

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: St. Digue
description:
St. Digue is the solo alias of Copenhagen-based artist, singer and producer Kasper Deichmann. Since 2020 his unique take on dark electronic music has sent shock waves through Copenhagen’s underground scene.

With ethereal synthesizers, infectious guitars, pounding drum machines, industrial soundscapes, melancholic melodies and desperate screams, he invites you into a neurodivergent universe characterized by trauma, otherness and armageddon.

Combine that with his punky D.I.Y. approach, his black metal roots and his flair for experimentation, he has cemented himself as a boundary pushing force to be reckoned with.

name: SYL
description:
SYL is a piercing live band that emerged during a time without live music. This Copenhagen-based Post-Hardcore band blends the best of the punk world with influences from Noise Rock and Hardcore. The band originated when two friends, Andreas Grønne (drums) and Benjamin Clemens (vocals), woke up after a serious binge on Norwegian punk and Finnish peppermint liqueur and realized that both had the word "SYL" tattooed prominently across their chests. The details of why exactly the word "SYL" had to be immortalized in ink remain shrouded in haze, but what they did have now was the name of the band they didn't yet know would exist.

The lyrical universe touches on everything from the anxieties of youth to masculinity and vulnerability, while Benjamin's aggressive vocals weave a melodic thread through the noisy backdrop. With a forceful expression and their hard-hitting melodic punk, SYL takes you into a world that encourages letting emotions flow freely.

name: Noah Carter
description:
The mythical B.O.C rapper is back. Now in Danish. Noah Carter burst onto the scene as one of Danish music's great hopes in 2016. He delivered several English-language smash hits, with ‘Do You’ and ‘Come Alive’ particularly standing out. His success led to sold-out concerts, including a legendary and completely overcrowded performance at Roskilde Festival's Countdown stage in his debut year. Noah was also nominated for several awards and gained both attention and radio support from abroad.

Since Noah's third album, there has been deafening silence outwardly. But plenty of music has been made. And now the album ‘Noah's Ark’ has been released. An album in Danish that has been requested by fans for many years. An album where Noah delivers strong, sensitive, and noticeable bars and is joined by several childhood friends from B.O.C.

The concert at SPOT 2024 is one you won't want to miss. Perhaps the first opportunity to experience the recognizable sound, the well-produced beats, and the new, Danish-language rap delivered on ‘Noah's Ark’.

name: ANYA
description:
ANYA made her debut in 2015 with the critically acclaimed EP 'The Credit,' featuring hits like 'Snap Back' and 'Need to Know' that received extensive radio play. Over the past few years ANYA has established herself as a significant artist in the Danish pop scene. After an explosive start to her career, ANYA followed up with strong singles such as 'Doorstep,' 'Overrun,' and 'Avalanche,' eventually releasing her debut album 'Faith' in 2019. Following the release of 'Faith,' the singer chose to explore her songwriting in Danish with the EP 'Nøgen,' released in 2020.

In the fall of 2023, the Danish-American singer released her single 'Sad Story,' which quickly gained popularity on P3. This marked the beginning of a new chapter and the announcement of ANYA's second album, 'Kodak,' set to be released on April 19, 2024. The album takes us back to ANYA's American roots, featuring singles like 'Daydream' and 'See Me' ft. Bbybites, showcasing ANYA's ability to blend Scandinavian pop with American R&B.

name: AKABANGA
description:
AKABANGA constantly explores new currents and beats from the African diaspora, creating their own form of Afrobeat where they blend melodies, beats, rhythms, and sounds from many different traditions.

With a general curiosity and a burning desire to create pure ecstasy, AKABANGA finds inspiration in various street parties around the world. Whether it's Baila Funk, Gqom, or Balani, they combine these elements into their unique and original club music, bringing authenticity to the club scene. The music can at times be repetitive and almost trance-like, but it also contains elements of wildness and ecstasy. AKABANGAs infectious energy guarantees a huge party, and there are always good summer vibes in the air at their concerts.

name: Bab L’ Bluz
description:
Bab L'Bluz (literally "The door of the Blues") is a Franco-Moroccan group created in 2018 in Marrakech following the meeting of the Moroccan singer/guitarist Yousra Mansour and the French guitarist / producer Brice Bottin. Passionate about Gnawa music, they decide to learn together the guembri. It is from this French-Moroccan fusion that a new repertoire of 10 tracks of music will be born. 

Armed with their electric guembris, Bab L' Bluz resonates a mixture of Gnawa trance rhythms, Hassani songs from southern Morocco and Chaâbi polyrhythms, propelling their music into the magnetic fields of psychedelic rock and volutes of incense. Led by a woman doukkalia, the group wants to carry a revolution of attitude being part of the movement of the Moroccan youth "Nayda", a new wave of artists and committed musicians who are inspired by the local heritage and sing texts of freedom in the Moroccan-Arabic dialect, the darija.

name: Big Mess
description:
Copenhagen punk/power pop band Big Mess is all hooks and energy. Taking cues from the timeless masters of melody, loud guitar and high BPMs, their music packs an infectious punch.

‘Cleaning Up With Big Mess’ (2023) is the band's first album with UK label Specialist Subject. This is Big Mess at their most accomplished yet, and shows total dedication to creating the ultimate hit. The UK connection yielded a run of shows in March 2024, including the prestigious Manchester Punk Festival.

Big Mess’ music is effortless and relentless, Brill Building sparkle and hardcore punk economy. The songs are heartfelt and occasionally stupid, reflecting the difficulties of existence and the joys of rocking.

name: Favorite Things · SPOT Afterparty
description:
If you want to finish of your SPOT 2024 with a dance party that lasts all night look to Volume Village, where Favorite Things Aarhus invite you to an afterparty saturday night with soulful rap from CHIEF and a strong DJ lineup consisting of Jolie Kubini, Simon Alejandro and Malte Sanggaard. 

CHIEF is a soulful rapper, who with rhythmic consciousness, creates a new wave of activism through music.

Based in Copenhagen, born in Aarhus and of Tanzanian descent, Jolie explores sounds from Africa and the African diaspora. From beats with Highlife samples to Gqom, Kuduro and beyond, she aspires to bring you unique selections, old and new, that are not necessarily found on the top music charts. Jolie has been spinning records on various stages in Denmark, Uganda and Sweden spreading heaps of knowledge and soul.

Simon Alejandro, the daily leader of the Norwegian cultural organization Jungelen, plays music from Guadeloupe, Cape Verde, Congo, Colombia, and Algeria. Alejandro makes things happen in Bergen and has been a leading entrepreneur for the music community in the city for many years as an organizer, DJ, workshop coordinator, and community builder both locally and internationally.

The leader of the initiative Favorite Things, Malte Sanggaard, has built a strong reputation as a DJ in recent years. With a curious approach and a broad taste, Malte manages to shape the soundscapes for anything from a calm rainy day to a cozy dance evening. Malte Sanggaard loves exploring musical trends and stories from around the world. As a DJ, he blends genres and styles, surprising listeners and expanding horizons. In recent years, he has performed at festivals and clubs in Aarhus, Copenhagen, and Bergen, as well as on radio stations in New York and Montpellier.

name: Rayne Waters
description:
A static collision ensues when the Aarhus-based underground duo Rayne Waters takes the stage, showering the audience with melancholic drops of Danish-language poetry, while noisy rock surfaces and hard-hitting beats hit your chest like lightning. Niklas Runge generously shares his sharply captivating vocals, enveloped in heavy bass lines and trembling synth landscapes crafted by Daniel Larsen.

Presented by The Royal Academy of Music

name: URO
description: Jeppe Kronback, known by the stage name URO, is a young, self-made songwriter, and producer from the suburbs of Copenhagen. In the past couple of years, URO has managed to break through with his honest and soulful urban pop music, telling heart-wrenching true stories from his past while also looking towards a bright future. It is URO's reflective and refined lyrics, in particular, that make him truly special. The singer kickstarted his career back in 2020 with the EP 'I Storslået Kinddans, Med Livet Som Indsats,' and in early 2023, he released the single 'Føles Godt,' featuring Mekdes. URO is ready to take the audience on a journey. He is a storyteller and musician, where unexpected turns, catchy melodies, and flow take center stage.

name: USSEL
description:
After triumphing in Karrierekanonen 2022, USSEL hasn't looked back. It all culminated with the release of the debut album ‘ENGLE & BLAA MAERKER’.

‘ENGLE & BLAA MAERKER’ is a tribute to honesty and sensitivity. USSEL's voice cuts through the sonic landscape, reaching deep into listeners' souls, making each song an intense experience. This can for example be heard on the single ‘Oslo til København’ which tells a touching story of a love without borders.

USSEL's music is hard to categorize into boxes or genres, as he manages to fuse different styles in his own unique way. His ability to challenge musical conventions makes him an artist who stands out in the music landscape. With an undeniable presence and towering intensity on stage, USSEL, along with his band, will create a concert experience featuring both 'ENGLE & BLAA MAERKER' and unreleased songs from the upcoming work ‘Jeg Vil Ikke Vide Du Findes’.

name: Anthon Edwards
description:
Anthon Edwards started his career as one half of the duo Citybois which, with more than 200 million streams, a critically acclaimed album with hits like ‘Sig Mig’ and ‘Finde Tilbage’, and sold out shows all over Denmark, was one of the biggest pop acts of 2020.

Since then, 25 year old Anthon has released his own singles such as ‘Smukke Pige’, ‘Enkelt Nat’, ‘Ansigt Til Ansigt’ and ‘Riv Mit Hjerte Ud’. Additionally he is performing with Burhan G on ‘Holder Os Vågne’, Marcus.wav and Thøger Dixgaard on ‘Live Forever’ and Karl William on ‘MER SOM’. In 2022, Anthon Edwards took a break from releasing new music and went into the studio. He has been working with new producers, and has found a distinct new sound - and now he is looking forward to presenting the result to his fans.

name: Rune Rask
description: Rune Rask is one of Denmark's most established, respected, and award-winning producers. Besides those accolades, he is also the mind and heart behind the musical brilliance that forms the framework for one of the country's largest hip-hop acts. In 2021, Rune Rask made his debut in his own name for the first time with the instrumental concept album, 'Rune Rask,' followed by the release of 'Face Yourself' in 2023. Rune Rask's solo project is driven by the desire to invite the listener into his unstoppable musical output. He opens up an exotic jungle of sounds—captivating and imaginative, but above all, with room for the audiences.

name: Uden Ord
description:
Standing in the forest, lying by the water's edge, or riding bikes in the sun; here you can find Uden Ord singing their songs. They are an alternative pop trio, aiming to create easily understandable music with room for the unconventional and the honest. Their music is unpredictable, but the love for beautiful melodies and soft words is a constant guiding star as you wander through their musical landscapes with them.

The lyrics of Uden Ord are open like small doors to new worlds. These worlds can sometimes be grim, but above all, they are filled with hope and care! Uden Ord consists of the three songwriters William Spanggaard Nielsen, Gustav Hedemann Christensen (Sortblod), and Thomas Mulcahy Alexandersen (kingtommi). In 2023, their album 'Verden Den Er Lige Her' was released, receiving 5 stars from Soundvenue.

name: Goss
description:
Dynamic themes, musical and organic productions and a characteristic vocal is what distinguishes Goss. 

With his contemplative lyrics Goss has a unique view of the human journey through a modern world, where gains and hurts are often up and down on the scales of the universe.

Goss is renowned as one of the most original live acts in Denmark, giving the audience an exhilarating and dynamic experience with tender and vulnerable moments, and often leaving venues and sites astonished.

name: Smokey
description:
Since her early teenage years, Smokey has cultivated her tireless interest in electronic music. With technical perfectionism and a sensitive understanding of mood, she effortlessly weaves tracks together across genres and time periods, juggling freshly cut dubplates with ancient gems.

A Smokey DJ set is equal parts love and respect for music but gives zero fucks for traditional genre divisions and conventions. Bootlegs, vocal samples, bass, breaks, electro, and dubstep are woven together into a tapestry that envelops the audience, creating a vacuum where sound shapes reality like clay and morphs time and space into new dimensions.

With nearly 15 years in the game, Smokey's unique approach and energetic pursuit of honing her craft have brought her to some of club culture's strongholds like Berghain, Boiler Room, Ibiza, and Roskilde Festival, while maintaining contact with small dark basements with big sound systems.

name: TELUS
description:
TELUS is a young Danish post-punk group that takes to the stage with unpolished feelings. In the borderlands between post-punk, alternative and pop, an emotional vocal, hard-hitting drums, catchy melodies and atmospheric soundscapes melt together. The band has created a dynamic sound incorporating both uplifting melodies, heavy shoegaze-inspired pieces and vulnerable ballads about life.

In 2021 TELUS participated in the finale of the talent show Band Battle Skråen. Since then the band has supported acts like Patina, Søn, Jung and KALASET. In September 2023 the band successfully played a sold out release show at 1000Fryd for their debut-EP. The single ‘Apart’ (2023) has been broadcasted on P6 Beat and received praise from Bands of Tomorrow and Good Because Danish. The debut EP ‘Love Songs for Strangers’ is a collection of songs, and dives into the turbulent and meaningful relationships that mark young adult life in a fleeting age.

With a soundscape that unites nostalgic references and current innovation, TELUS has created a piece and a sound that explores complex feelings - from the uplifting moments of love and celebration to the more sinister aspects like doubt, heartbreak and mental health.

name: Doed Asfalt
description:
To begin with, Doed Asfalt was an attempt at playing music that would fit what the name designates: the kind of road that takes forever to get through although nothing seems to hold you back. Similarly, Doed Asfalt is rock music played really fast, but limited to a few, simple ideas. It never really goes anywhere, while putting a lot of effort into doing just that. From the original idea of guitarist and singer, Esben, Doed Asfalt has developed into that classic rock format, the trio, with Emil on bass and Anders on drums. It’s fast and it’s hopefully fun.

In 2023 Doed Asfalt released their first EP Hesitant which was played on DR P6 Beat. Critics could hear references such as Psyched Up Janis, Jay Reatard, Dinosaur Jr. and Hüsker Dü. Doed Asfalt will soon release their debut album which is recorded and mixed by Jens Benz (Iceage, Yung, etc.).

name: Merro8
description:
The dynamic rapper Merro8 has made waves in the Danish hip hop scene with his unique fusion of street melancholy and sensitivity. Known for hits like '2 Kanoner' and 'Draco,' he is recognized for combining rap rhythms with a distinct vibe from the northwestern part of Copenhagen.

Merro8's latest release, 'Intet Nyt,' from 2024 features Gilli, showcasing a more pop and house-influenced side. However, Merro8 also embraces the sensitive aspects of the genre, as demonstrated in the acoustic version of '2 Kanoner.' Merro8 encompasses many facets of rap music, and his embrace of the genre's diverse elements has rapidly increased his listener base, with several million streams in a very short period.

Merro8's live ambitions are steadily growing, and he is more than ready to conquer the rap scene with an energetic show focused on light and performance.

name: CHÆK
description:
The ether vibrates and the instruments nonchalantly welcome you to the new multiverse, you now get to experience. Around you the loose ends come together in a huge arrow pointing to CHÆK. Experiencing CHÆK evokes feelings from times past with convincing deliveries and raw atmosphere.

In the middle of the trance-inducing cascade, aggressive but hopeful messages fly from the stage with explosive force. The unique composition of thought through characters makes the band stand strong on stage. With their young age they manage to give the music business a well deserved slap in the face. How hard can it be to become legends? That’s how it feels seeing CHÆK live in action.

name: PRISMA
description:
The Danish sister duo PRISMA has been taking the Danish music scene by storm since 2021 with hits like 'I Never Wanted To Meet You' and 'Bangs', as well as their EP 'Inside Out'. Sirid and Frida sing in harmony, blending indie and rock to portray the struggles of youth in a way that has delighted both critics and live audiences. This success has already led to several awards, including a DMA, a Carl Prize, and most recently the 'Nutidens Unge'-award presented by the band tv-2 as part of the Thursday concert before SPOT 2023.

Currently, PRISMA is promoting their single 'Kingdom'. The song is a sensitive electro-inspired piece with a grand, almost community-oriented chorus.

PRISMA has not only impressed nationally but has also conquered international stages, appearing at influential festivals such as WayOutWest and Dockville. 2024 is shaping up to be another burgeoning year for PRISMA, who have already solidified their position as one of Denmark's most promising live acts with their unique sound, musical abilities, and special energy on stage.

name: Ammar808
description:
Sofyann Ben Youssef AKA Ammar808 is the mastermind behind the critically acclaimed albums « Maghreb United » and « Global Control / Invisible Invasion », not forgetting the late project Bargou08. Before setting base camp in Denmark, he went on an extraordinary journey that made him the godfather of the Tunisian alternative and electronic scene. Bred as a musicologist in the corridors of Tunis’ Music Institute, he specializes in Arabic and Indian music. As an avid listener, he strives for bridges between oriental and occidental music. This thirst for yet unheard musical blends led him to settle in Vienna, then Brussels, where he met Anana, vocalist and guitarist of the Touareg Band Kel Assouf. Sofyann produced their albums and joined the live band, bringing his sub-harmonic Moog Bass to the Desert Blues cocktail.

He now operates his own mothership studio in Kjellerup, Denmark, where he works as a composer, producer, sound engineer and music production teacher.

name: Ung-Skab
description:
UNG-SKAB mirrors a generation of young people who wear their emotions on their sleeves and shed honest tears. Over Eigil Bjørn Meldgaard's productions, which stubbornly explore the borderland between R&B, pop, and trap, Clara Rose Lundberg's ethereal arrangements hover, seducing the listener into UNG-SKAB's world.

Since the release of their debut EP 'UNG-SKAB' in 2021, the duo has, among other things, sold out the main stage at Pumpehuset and played at 'VEGA's Selection'. In connection with the release of their latest single 'Snakker Lort', the group was featured in DR P3's program series, 'Upcoming'. In March 2023, UNG-SKAB embarked on their first Danish tour, culminating in December at Store VEGA in a resounding sold-out double concert with APHACA.

UNG-SKAB is groovy, melancholic summer sound. It's the sound of dearest friends and heartache, summer parties, and sunrises.

name: Elsked
description:
A new fascination for electronic music has found its feet in Denmark. Elsked leads the way in this movement with their captivating debut EP 'Piratradio'. The title track of ‘Piratradio’ revolves around removing your life experiences and opening up to a new and fresh consciousness. In many ways, the EP focuses on rethinking oneself, much like the music is a refreshing renewal of the electronic genre in Denmark.

Elsked's sound universe is full of contrasts. The productions are driven intensely by pumping club rhythms, sizzling percussion, and synthesizers that sound both 90s nostalgic and like a distant future simultaneously. The deep vocals and choral arrangements add a grandiose effect, supporting the lyrical themes of love and the art of letting go.

name: N.E. GIRL
description:
N.E.GIRL has been heavily inspired by soundsystem culture and alternative club styles from the UK and global underground, building a reputation for her multi-genre style.

As a club promoter and festival curator, she aims to showcase bass-driven and experimental styles either within her DJ sets or through the events she programs, exploring the boundaries of multi-genre mixing.
